This represents a significant milestone in the fields of missile defence and air defence for all NATO countries, for Europe and for the United States. The installation of the US base in Redzikowo will serve to enhance the security of Europe, the United States, Poland and NATO as a whole. It will contribute to the strengthening of the most powerful alliance in the modern world - Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak - Kamysz stated during the opening of the base in Redzikowo.

title: Meeting between Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz and NATO Secretary General
description: - We discussed, with NATO Secretary General, the most pressing challenges facing NATO, Poland's role within the Alliance, and the nature of our interactions. Poland is a reliable ally, and we are committed to upholding our obligations as set forth in the North Atlantic Treaty. We expect the same level of commitment from our allies. The most pressing security concerns were discussed, and I also delivered a presentation on the provision of assistance to Ukraine. I emphasised that Poland has been providing support to Ukraine since the outset of the conflict, implementing a whole range of possible measures to assist the country. On behalf of the Chief of the General Staff of the Polish Armed Forces, General Dymanowski presented details of the support provided to Ukraine. The Secretary General and his delegation were highly impressed by Poland's actions since the outset of the war in Ukraine – W. Kosiniak – Kamysz said following the meeting with the NATO Secretary General.

title: Celebrating the 106th anniversary of Poland's independence
description: On 11 November, central celebrations of the National Independence Day were held in Warsaw with the participation of President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, as well as the highest state authorities and the Polish Army. The celebrations were attended by Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of National Defence, representing the President of the Council of Ministers.

title: Dancon March in Kosovo
description: On January 5, 2025, another edition of the Dancon March took place, well-known and very popular among KFOR soldiers.

title: Support from PKW UNIFIL soldiers
description: UNIFIL PMC soldiers not only ensure security in the "blue line" area in southern Lebanon, but also help the local community affected by the consequences of the conflict.

title: Joint patrol operations
description: In the last decade of December of the past year, joint Polish-Latvian patrols took place, within the framework of which soldiers from Latvia cooperated closely with soldiers of the Polish Military Contingent KFOR.

title: Visit to PKW UNIFIL
description: On December 27-29, 2024, the Polish Military Contingent in Lebanon hosted the Deputy Chief of Staff for Operations - head of the division - Brig. Gen. Jarosław Chojnacki.

title: Soldiers from the 16th rotation of PKW Latvia visit a Polish school
description: On December 27, soldiers from the 16th rotation of the Polish Military Contingent in Latvia visited the Polish school in Rezekne as part of a humanitarian campaign aimed at supporting …

title: Christmas donation in Debel
description: During Christmas, military Santa Clauses from PKW UNIFIL visited the State Primary School in the city of Debel with gifts.

title: Simplified rules for granting the allowance for long-term military service
description: As of January 1, the rules for granting a bonus for long-term military service will be simplified. The bonus will be calculated after two years of military service at 2% of the basic salary due, and then increased by 1% each year.

title: Contract for a new ship for the Navy signed
description: "We are signing a contract for a rescue ship. According to the contract, the cutting of sheet metal should take place 12 months after signing the contract. We expect the keel to be laid 2 months later. However, the launch is planned for 2027," said Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak - Kamysz in Gdynia after signing a contract for the acquisition of a rescue ship for the Polish Navy under the "Ratownik" program. Deputy Minister Paweł Bejda also took part in the ceremony, which took place at the Naval Academy.

title: Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz: Victory did not come by itself. Victory was born over decades and generations.
description: Until the next meeting at this monument, until the 107th anniversary of the outbreak of the Greater Poland Uprising, one of the units in the Polish Army will bear the name of the victorious Greater Poland Uprising. We must do more to increase the awareness of the victorious patriotism - informed Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak - Kamysz during the celebrations of the 106th anniversary of the Greater Poland Uprising.

title: Christmas wishes
Air shield for missile launchers
description: On December 24 this year, at the Armament Agency, in the presence of the Secretary of State at the Ministry of National Defense, Paweł Bejda, an agreement was signed for the acquisition of unmanned aerial systems for the protection of divisional fire modules of the Homar-K launcher.

title: Draft act amending the act on the symbols of the Armed Forces of the Republic of Poland adopted by the Council of Ministers
description: The Council of Ministers has adopted a draft act amending the Act on the symbols of the Armed Forces of the Republic of Poland, submitted by the Minister of National Defence.

title: Christmas meeting with soldiers serving in POLLOGHUB
description: - You are doing a wonderful job. You are performing an exceptional service. Please accept my best wishes - for you, for your families, for those you will meet, and also for those who will be waiting for you because you have to stay away from home. I wish you health, prosperity, peace and quiet, goodness and beauty in the coming year. May it bring you as much joy and satisfaction as possible, and strengthen our national community. You serve Poland well, you serve the Homeland well - said Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz during a Christmas meeting with POLLOGHUB soldiers in Rzeszów.

title: 17 billion zlotys for the purchase of equipment for the Polish Army in the Polish arms industry
description: Over PLN 17 billion is the sum of the contracts signed today with the Polish arms industry for the supply of equipment for the Polish Army.

title: Observation satellites will strengthen the image reconnaissance capabilities of the Polish Army
description: - Security and economy meet in the Ministry of National Defense. We invest in the Polish army, buying from Polish entrepreneurs, implementing the 50/50 assumption. We deliver increasingly modern equipment. Today, however, we are going a step further - we are entering the space of the future, outer space. We have decided to build drone forces, a medical component, and also to develop operational capabilities in outer space - in the field of observation and tactical operations. The agreement signed today regarding four satellites in the Mikroglob program is an extraordinary achievement of the Polish Armed Forces. It expands our capabilities, increases operability and provides imaging capabilities necessary for tactical and operational operations - said Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz after signing the agreement for observation satellites for the Polish Army.

title: Christmas Eve meeting with soldiers of PKW Romania
description: - This is always an extraordinary moment - you can visit our heroes, our soldiers who serve outside the borders of the homeland. They serve in Polish military contingents. (...) I am very happy about this visit in the pre-Christmas time. We will have another opportunity to exchange wishes, so at this solemn roll call I want to talk about the strategy, the most important challenges for Poland, for NATO, for our allies and for Romania, because these are common challenges for people who share the same values ​​- freedom, justice, good and beauty. These values ​​are described in our Constitution, as well as in the most important legal acts of the Romanian state - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz during his visit to the National Electoral Commission in Romania.

title: We remember those who died on missions abroad
description: - This is an incredibly moving moment. A December evening that pierces our hearts, our minds, our souls. The heroes of this evening are those who gave their lives for their homeland – 123 people since the 1950s, who died in missions and operations outside Poland. 123 people whom we remember, whom we name, whom we honor and pay tribute to. And their families – those who come here every year, those who stand before this monument every year with a pensive face, with tears in their eyes and with a heart that will never find solace after the loss of loved ones. Never. I know and realize that there are no words that could encompass the pain of losing a husband, father or son. These are soldiers and civilian employees of the Polish Army. Behind each of these names on this wall there is a story – a story of life, devotion to the homeland and often tragic death. Thank you for being here together - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz.

title: Christmas Eve meeting with soldiers
description: - There is something that unites Poles: Christmas, the white and red flag, our national emotions, colors, the anthem. And there is something else sacred that unites Poles - love for the Polish Army. (...) Wishing you, your loved ones, all military families - because they serve together with you, a soldier never serves alone, his entire family serves - I wish you peace and quiet, a good and blessed Christmas. I also wish that you and all of us will be able to fulfill the obligations that the citizens of the Republic of Poland impose on us: this great love and trust in the Polish Army. All the best for Christmas and the New Year. May God bless our beloved homeland - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz during the Christmas Eve meeting.

title: New Grot, Vis and under-barrel grenade launchers for Polish Army soldiers
description: - We are investing once again in Polish companies and equipping Polish soldiers. (…) After purchasing drones, after launching the Patriot system in initial readiness in the Wisła program yesterday, after purchasing tankers (…) and purchasing 80 Rosomaks in the L version, the time has come for something that is essential for every soldier and with which he must be equipped. Carbines, pistols, grenade launchers suspended from Grot carbines - these are the purchases we are making today - said Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak - Kamysz after signing a contract for the supply of weapons for soldiers of the Polish Army.

title: Awards for soldiers of the Polish Army
description: - I appreciate the engineering, chemical, medical forces and all the operational forces who devoted their time and strength, often in difficult conditions and with great emotions, to carry out the tasks assigned to them. Everyone is needed in the army - both the commander and the executors of the tasks. Without you, the best specialists, the implementation of these activities would not be possible - said Deputy Prime Minister W. Kosiniak-Kamysz during a meeting with the soldiers of Operation Feniks.

title: A noble cause! CWZS soldiers support the Charity Calendar
description: Charity Calendar of Stars by Senior Private Specialist Angelika Wątor in cooperation with the soldiers-athletes from CWZS is now available! This unique project, carried out for the Judyta Foundation, …

title: Support from PKW UNIFIL soldiers
description: UNIFIL PMC soldiers not only ensure security in the "blue line" area in southern Lebanon, but also help the local community affected by the consequences of the conflict.

title: Remembering the fallen and those who died outside the country's borders
description: "A Polish soldier fights for the freedom of all nations, but dies only for Poland" – Lieutenant General Stanisław Maczek

title: Joint boxing training under the watchful eye of champions
description: Private Julia Szeremeta and Corporal Mateusz Masternak, at the invitation of Maj. Gen. Arkadiusz Szkutnik from the 18th Mechanized Division, visited soldiers serving in the town of Karakule …

title: Santa's Joy Patrol
description: Soldiers made the little hero's dream come true

title: Rescue duty in the Tatra Mountains
description: On Saturday, December 14, 2024, the Air Search and Rescue Team No. 1 (LZPR-1) ended its mission in the Tatra Mountains. Over the past few weeks, the team has supported the activities of the Tatra Volunteer …

title: The head of the National Security Bureau began a 4-day visit to the Baltic countries
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, began a 4-day visit to the Nordic and Baltic countries today - Sweden, Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. The talks are related to the urgent need to strengthen international cooperation in the Baltic region, which is key to NATO and EU security. Especially in the context of the intensification of Russia's hostile actions in the Baltic Sea.

title: Saint Florian's Cross for the late Kazimierz Leszczyński
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, posthumously awarded the Cross of St. Florian to the late Kazimierz Leszczyński, Honorary President of the OSP Michowice, for outstanding achievements in the implementation of tasks resulting from being a member of the volunteer fire brigade.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau at the signing of the contract for "Rescuer"
description: "Ratownik" is a unit without which no major Navy in the world can function. Meanwhile, no major country in the world whose security depends on the sea can exist without the Navy - emphasized the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera, who took part in Friday's signing of the agreement to acquire a rescue ship for the Polish Navy under the "Ratownik" program.

title: President to "Neue Zürcher Zeitung": Russia is not only flexing its muscles, but is also threatening Europe with aggression
description: NATO must react dynamically and anticipate the actions of its opponents. Russia is not only flexing its muscles, but also threatening Europe with aggression. However, it must feel that NATO is like an iron fist and that it will end very badly for it - said the President in an interview for the Swiss newspaper "Neue Zürcher Zeitung".

title: Meeting with the families of soldiers who died abroad
description: On the occasion of the upcoming Day of Remembrance of the Fallen and Deceased in Military Missions and Operations Outside the Country, the Presidential Couple met with the families of deceased soldiers.

title: The Presidential Couple at a Christmas wafer meeting with soldiers
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda and his wife Agata Kornhauser-Duda took part in a Christmas Eve meeting in uniform at the 1st Transport Aviation Base in Warsaw.

title: Meeting with NATO Secretary General
description: President Andrzej Duda, at the invitation of NATO Secretary General Marek Rutte, took part in a working meeting of a group of leaders of the Alliance, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky and EU representatives, devoted to coordinating an urgent increase in military and economic support for Ukraine.

title: The Act on Population Protection and Civil Defense signed by the President of the Republic of Poland
description: On December 18, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of December 5, 2024 on Population Protection and Civil Defense

title: BBN chief: emphasis on development of national defence capabilities
description: "(...) the emphasis should be put first on the development of our own national defence capabilities and taking over both setting an example and leadership on the flank" - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera, who was a guest on Tuesday on the "Trójkąt Polityczny" programme broadcast by TVP Info.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The Presidential Couple's Christmas Eve Uniform Meeting
description: On December 19 this year (Thursday) at 11:30 a.m. at the 1st Transport Aviation Base in Warsaw, the President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda and his wife Agata Kornhauser-Duda will take part in a uniformed Christmas Eve meeting.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau at the ceremony of the 54th anniversary of December '70
description: On Tuesday at six o'clock in Gdynia, in front of the Monument to the Victims of December 1970, ceremonies were held to mark the 54th anniversary of Black Thursday – the massacre of shipyard workers at the Gdynia Stocznia SKM station on 17 December 1970. The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, who represented President Andrzej Duda on site, read a letter from the head of state addressed to the organisers and participants of the celebrations.

title: Vistula. Meeting of the Presidents of the Visegrad Group Countries
description: The leaders of the Visegrad Group countries discussed today in Wisła – at the invitation of President Andrzej Duda – the prevention of crisis situations, especially in the context of floods, as well as the situation in Ukraine and ways to end the war taking place there.

title: Minister Jacek Siewiera: Ukraine should be included in NATO
description: The possibility of the UA joining NATO is a multi-year process and requires the unity of allies. Today, it is not visible here. Although from the Polish perspective, it is necessary for the UA to be in the Alliance - emphasized Minister Jacek Siewiera, who was a guest on the morning show "Bez Uników" on Program 3 of Polish Radio. As he added, what we can achieve in 2025 is a form of ceasefire in Ukraine - Russia will not withdraw, and retaking territories with the weapons that the Ukrainians have is not possible.

title: Act on financing activities aimed at increasing the capacity for ammunition production signed by the President of the Republic of Poland
description: On December 9, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of November 27, 2024 on the financing of activities aimed at increasing the capacity for ammunition production.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the coup in Syria: from Poland's point of view, I see many potential threats here
description: "It is worth paying attention to two issues here - the military and political dimensions, because in both - I have the impression - the optimism associated with the belief that this is a great defeat of the Russian Federation is too far-reaching. This form of optimism can be maintained by global powers" - emphasized the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera during Monday's edition of the program "Fakty po faktach" on TVN24. "From the point of view of regional security and Poland's interests, I see many potential threats here" - assessed the minister.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: a Ministry of Arms should be established in Poland
description: We are as a society ready to spend huge amounts of money on armaments if it involves the delivery of new tanks or missiles. However, it is difficult to explain to society the costs associated with storing ammunition or training, noted the head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera on Monday. As he pointed out, he is convinced of the need to establish an armaments ministry in Poland, similar to DAPA in South Korea or SSB in Turkey.

title: BBN chief: Russia is currently unable to conduct operations in many theaters
description: The coup in Syria, the fall of the regime is a message to global powers that the Russian Federation - with its involvement in Ukraine - is not able to conduct operations in many theaters - assessed the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera. During the conference entitled "Lessons from the war in Ukraine - equipment and structure of the Polish army and Civil Defense" he also spoke about the situation in Syria.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the consequences of the fall of the Syrian regime for Poland's security
description: "After the phase of dynamic events that have taken place in Syria in recent days, each country must ask itself how this situation translates into its direct security interests," said the Head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, on TOK FM. "And this perspective is much less optimistic than what is described in the global dimension, for the big players," he emphasized.

title: The president in the flood-damaged areas
description: The President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda visited the areas destroyed during the September flood in the Opole province today. He visited Głuchołazy, Nysa and Bodzanów, talked with representatives of the uniformed services, the army and local government authorities. The President thanked everyone involved in helping to remove the effects of the flood and supporting the residents of these areas.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: Mining and the mining industry are and will remain an area of ​​state security
description: Mining and the mining industry are and will remain the security area of ​​this country - said the minister in the Chancellery of the President of the Republic of Poland, head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera to the participants of Tuesday's St. Barbara's Day celebrations of the State Mining Authority (WUG) in Katowice.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Visit of the President of the Republic of Poland to the areas destroyed by the flood
description: On December 4, 2024 (Wednesday), the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will visit the areas destroyed by the flood in the Opole Voivodeship, where he will meet with representatives of the uniformed services, the army and local government authorities.

title: Act signed by the President of the Republic of Poland
description: On November 29, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed:

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Head of the National Security Bureau at the Mining Authority's St. Barbara's Day
description: On 3rd December this year (Tuesday), at 11:00 the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera will take part in the ceremonial St. Barbara's Day academy of mining supervision, held at the Silesian Museum in Katowice (ul. T. Dobrowolskiego 1, Katowice). During the ceremony, the Minister will present state decorations on behalf of the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda.

title: Cadet Day celebration
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda took part in an assembly on the occasion of Officer Cadet Day and the 194th anniversary of the outbreak of the November Uprising.

title: Gdynia. Navy Day with the participation of the President of the Republic of Poland
description: President Andrzej Duda took part today in the celebrations of the 106th anniversary of the establishment of the Polish Navy. This year, for the first time, the celebrations took place on November 28 - the day of the adoption of the historic date of the establishment of the navy by Marshal Józef Piłsudski in 1918.

title: Jacek Siewiera: The Baltic Sea is the gateway to safety
description: This is a great opportunity to strengthen ties with countries that have a similar perception of the threat from Russia. Good understanding with Baltic and Scandinavian partners gives us a stronger voice in the EU and NATO – said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, on Radio ZET, commenting on the proposal to create a joint mission to patrol the waters of the Baltic Sea.

title: Meeting of the President with the Polish staff of the European Union Mission in Armenia
description: On the last day of his visit to Armenia, President Andrzej Duda took part in a patrol in Paruyr Sevak and met with Polish staff of the European Union Mission in the Republic of Armenia (EUMA), established under the common security and defence policy.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: President at the celebration of Officer Cadet Day
description: On November 29, 2024 (Friday) at 5:00 p.m. in the courtyard of Belweder Palace, the President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda will take part in a roll call on the occasion of Cadet Day and the 194th anniversary of the outbreak of the November Uprising.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: President at the Polish Navy Day
description: On November 28 this year (Thursday) at 11:30 the President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda will take part in the ceremonial celebration of the Polish Navy Day in Gdynia.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: Our security is based on the maritime economy
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, conducted reconnaissance in Świnoujście to secure critical infrastructure, the LNG terminal and the Baltic Pipe gas pipeline. Investments in port infrastructure are crucial both for Poland's energy security and for accepting potential allied assistance to secure NATO's eastern flank - he said.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The head of the National Security Bureau will review the security status of strategic maritime investments
description: On November 21 this year (Thursday) in Świnoujście, the Head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, will familiarize himself with the security status of critical maritime infrastructure and the implementation of strategic investments in the region.

title: Andrzej Duda visits Jordan. Polish-Jordanian military cooperation
description: President Andrzej Duda is visiting the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan. His talks with His Majesty Abdullah II Ibn Al Hussein concern bilateral and military cooperation and security issues in the context of the conflict in the Middle East and Russian aggression against Ukraine.

title: The President of the Republic of Poland signed an amendment to the Act on Fire Protection and the Volunteer Fire Department
description: On November 18, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of October 11, 2024 amending the Act on Fire Protection and the Act on Volunteer Fire Brigades.

title: Changes in counteracting the dissemination of terrorist content on the Internet
description: On November 15, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed:

title: Meeting of the President of the Republic of Poland with the Secretary General of NATO
description: Andrzej Duda talked today with NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte about increasing military production in Europe, the need to extend NATO pipelines to the countries of the eastern flank and the conditions for transferring more Polish fighter jets to Ukraine.

title: Opening of the American Aegis Ashore base in Redzikowo
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, took part in the opening of the American Aegis Ashore base in Redzikowo (Pomeranian Voivodeship), which is part of the NATO missile defense system.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Opening of the anti-missile base in Redzikowo
description: On Wednesday, November 13, 2024 at 1:00 p.m., the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will participate in the opening of the American Aegis Ashore anti-missile base in Redzikowo.

title: Celebration of National Independence Day
description: Celebrated today, the National Independence Day is one of the most important national holidays for Poles. In 1918, after 123 years of partition – captivity marked by struggle, suffering and effort of many generations of Poles – our country regained its sovereignty.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: November 13, the official opening of the anti-missile base in Redzikowo
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, announced on Monday that the official opening of the anti-missile base in Redzikowo (Pomeranian Voivodeship) will take place on November 13.

title: Polish aid for Ukraine
description: Poland ranks first (in relation to GDP) among all countries that have been involved in providing aid to Ukraine. Polish support was the first to reach the Ukrainian front in significant quantities. We have transferred the largest amount of heavy weapons. Poland is also among the top countries that have accepted the largest number of refugees in absolute numbers.

title: General nominations on the eve of the National Independence Day
description: On the eve of the National Independence Day, President Andrzej Duda presented generals' nominations to soldiers of the Polish Army, as well as officers of the Police and the State Fire Service, at the Presidential Palace.

title: General promotions in the State Fire Service and Police
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, awarded the rank of general to three officers of the State Fire Service and three officers of the Police. The presentation of nominations will take place on the eve of the National Independence Day, November 10, 2024, at the Presidential Palace.

title: BBN chief: Trump's victory will impact the world order
description: This is the moment when Poland's role in the European arena will be decided primarily by the activity of our politics, our ability to use this situation; I feel the opportunities that are associated with it - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera on Trójka, referring to Donald Trump's victory in the American presidential elections.

title: BBN chief: Warsaw should be active in relations with Washington and use all tools to do so
description: Fear and criticism of the choice made by the Americans by the European elites is counterproductive. Warsaw should be active in its relations with Washington and use all the tools to achieve this. These tools are on the President's side. It would be good if the political parties understood this - said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, on TVN24, commenting on Donald Trump's victory in the American presidential election.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The President of the Republic of Poland will present generals with promotions
description: On the eve of the National Independence Day, November 10, 2024 (Sunday) at 7:00 p.m., a ceremony of presenting general and admiral nominations to officers and officials by the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda will be held at the Presidential Palace.

title: General promotions in the Polish Armed Forces
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Polish Armed Forces Andrzej Duda, pursuant to Article 134, paragraph 5 of the Constitution of the Republic of Poland, at the request of the Minister of National Defense, appointed 12 officers of the Polish Army to the ranks of general and admiral. The acts of appointment will be presented by the President of the Republic of Poland on November 10, 2024, on the eve of the National Independence Day.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: today, the most important assets that shape the security environment and transatlantic relations between Warsaw and Washington are in the hands of the President
description: "It is worth being aware that today the most important assets of the Republic of Poland, which shape the security environment and transatlantic relations between Warsaw and Washington, are in the hands of President Andrzej Duda. It is worth the government and political parties to properly understand this importance, because our security really depends on it," said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, on the RMF FM radio station.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: The lack of systemic changes in the management of state defense is disturbing
description: The President's bill on the actions of state authorities in the event of an external threat to state security is still not being processed. "The state is still not drawing conclusions, despite the fact that the President - the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, the Prime Minister are traveling to a country ravaged by war. The vacancy of this position - not only due to death, but also lack of communication, contact for various reasons - is not a scenario that fits in our heads," emphasized the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera in "Kropka nad i". As he added, the management and command system has not been corrected, so certain solutions are on the table and it is time to take action.

title: Wywiad Prezydenta RP dla The Sunday Times
description: If the safety of my compatriots is to be ensured by the re-emergence of an "iron curtain", then so be it, an iron curtain will arise, as long as we are on its free side - said President Andrzej Duda in an interview for The Sunday Times.

title: Visit of the President of the Republic of Poland to Korean arms factories
description: On the last day of his visit to the Republic of Korea, President Andrzej Duda visited the Hyundai Rotem and Hanwha Aerospace plants, which execute contracts for equipment for the Polish armed forces.

title: The presidents of Poland and the Republic of Korea discuss military and economic cooperation.
description: On the next day of his visit to the Republic of Korea, the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda met with the President of the Republic of Korea Yoon Suk-yeol. Thursday's conversation concerned, among other things, economic and military cooperation. President Andrzej Duda expressed hope that "more good news will soon be announced in terms of military cooperation - I am thinking about the cooperation of the arms industries", related to the Polonization of equipment.

title: Seoul: NSB chief talks with South Korea's national security adviser
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, who is in Seoul, spoke on Wednesday with his South Korean counterpart, Shin Won-Sik, about current events related to the war in Ukraine, including possible South Korean support for Kiev and Polish-Korean military cooperation. The discussion also included disturbing information about North Korea's cooperation with Russia and the possible presence of North Korean soldiers on the territory of the Russian Federation. Both sides exchanged current knowledge regarding intelligence data.

title: New solutions encouraging the employment of soldiers performing active military service in WOT and AR
description: On October 17, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of October 1, 2024, amending certain acts in order to support entrepreneurs employing Territorial Defense Force soldiers or Active Reserve soldiers.

title: Conversation between the President of the Republic of Poland and the Secretary General of NATO
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, spoke by telephone this evening with the new NATO Secretary General, Mark Rutte.

title: Scholarship diplomas for the beneficiaries of the Grow Up with Us Foundation
description: At the Belweder Palace, the Presidential Couple presented scholarship certificates to children of fallen or wounded soldiers, officers and employees of public services – beneficiaries of the Grow Up with Us Foundation. Thanks to the initiative of the foundation, parents of those who fell, died or were wounded while performing their duties receive regular psychological and educational assistance, financial support and are prepared to enter adult life and the job market.

title: Easier return to service in the Police and Border Guard
description: On October 14, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of October 1, 2024, amending certain acts in connection with the establishment of uniformed services units and facilitating the return to service in the Police and Border Guard.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the Polish-Belarusian border. Strengthening security is "proof of the continuity of the state's strategic thinking"
description: "For the first time, you can document the engineering reinforcements that are the culmination of the experience of these three years of attempts to bend and force this barrier in many different ways, also carried out in recent months," said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, to journalists, who on Friday met with the services and the army on the border with Belarus in Połowce (Podlaskie) and watched the reinforcement of the barrier located there.

title: Head of BBN: Today, the key is very structured work on the structure and architecture of the new army
description: "Today, the key is very orderly work on the structure and architecture of the new army that Poland has started to build, on the achievements that have been accumulated in recent years," said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera on TV Republika, commenting on the security situation in connection with the war in Ukraine.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Visit of the Head of the National Security Bureau to the eastern border of Poland
description: On Friday, October 11, 2024, the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera will visit the Polish-Belarusian border, where he will familiarize himself with the current security situation. The Minister will meet with representatives of the services responsible for securing the eastern border of Poland and check the status of work on strengthening the border infrastructure on the section with Belarus.

title: Minister Siewiera: Poland is playing a difficult game to obtain the right place in NATO
description: "Unfortunately, due to domestic political tensions, all personnel attempts to strengthen our position in NATO that we have undertaken recently have not been successful. (...) I believe that with the arrival of the new Secretary General, a certain pool of opportunities will open up again and will take into account the key role of the largest country on the eastern flank," said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, in an interview with "Gazeta Polska".

title: Inauguration of the academic year at the Military University of Technology
description: I believe that the academic year that is just beginning will result in the preparation of the next generation of officers who, after graduating from the Military University of Technology, will serve in responsible positions in the Polish Armed Forces – said President Andrzej Duda during the ceremonial inauguration of the academic year 2024/2025.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: threats require offensive technologies in the cyber area
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, said on Wednesday that the threats we will be dealing with require us to begin work on the use of offensive technologies in the cyber area.

title: Head of National Security Bureau: Russia wants to revise the world order
description: – When it comes to nuclear weapons, let’s not copy the Kremlin’s disastrous practices – says Jacek Siewiera, head of the National Security Bureau, in an interview for “Rzeczpospolita”

title: President of the Republic of Poland at the Warsaw Security Forum: bold political decisions are needed to rebuild the defense potential
description: "We should focus on two tasks. First, on how to help Ukraine win the war, and second - how to strengthen our own capabilities to ensure security and stable development of our countries."

title: BBN chief at WSF: Poland, EU and NATO cannot lose sight of the fundamental threat
description: Poland, the EU and NATO, despite the crises, cannot lose sight of the fundamental threat from the East, stressed Jacek Siewiera, the head of the National Security Bureau, during the Warsaw Security Forum on Tuesday. By deciding, among other things, on record spending on defence, we are building potential, but this effort must be long-term, he emphasised.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The President of the Republic of Poland at the inauguration of the academic year at WAT
description: On Wednesday, October 2, 2024, at 10:00 a.m., the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will participate in the ceremonial inauguration of the 2024/2025 academic year at the Military University of Technology (WAT Club, ul. gen. Sylwestra Kaliskiego 25a, Warsaw).

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Head of BBN at Warsaw Security Forum
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, will take part in the Warsaw Security Forum conference (DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel, ul. Skalnicowa 21, Warsaw).

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: President of the Republic of Poland at the Warsaw Security Forum
description: On Tuesday, October 1, 2024, at approx. 2:00 p.m., the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will participate in the Warsaw Security Forum (Hotel DoubleTree by Hilton, ul. Skalnicowa 21, Warsaw).

title: Speech by the President of the Republic of Poland at the UN Security Council
description: "The world cannot afford for the Security Council to be unable to meet its obligations under the Charter. We need an effective, transparent, representative and accountable body," said President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda during a debate at the UN Security Council.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: The President of the Republic of Poland will closely monitor the process of rebuilding flood areas
description: The President unequivocally declares that he will systematically visit the areas destroyed by the flood in order to regularly review the completion of the phase of removing the direct effects of the flood, as well as the reconstruction process – said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, in "Fakty po faktach".

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the fight against a natural disaster in southern Poland
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, gave the country a "sufficient plus" mark for its actions in the preparatory phase for the flood; "four plus" for saving the lives and property of residents, and "five minus" for removing the direct effects of the flood.

title: President Andrzej Duda in towns destroyed by flood
description: The President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda visited Lądek-Zdrój and Głuchołazy – towns destroyed by floods. Andrzej Duda familiarized himself with the scale of destruction, talked with residents and representatives of local authorities and uniformed services.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Visit of the President of the Republic of Poland to the flood-affected areas
description: Today, on September 20, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda will visit the flood-damaged areas in the Lower Silesian and Opole Voivodeships. The President will meet with representatives of the services involved in rescue operations, the military, and local government authorities.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: The President will visit the flood-affected areas on Friday
description: There is a plan for the President to visit the areas affected by the flood so as not to interfere with the work of the rescue services, so as not to disrupt rescue operations. The plan for such a visit is planned for Lower Silesia on Friday from early morning hours - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: Construction of retention reservoirs must be an element of consensus in the national security strategy
description: We need to assess the extent of the damage caused by the flood and assess the costs of building retention reservoirs. And answer the question of what price we are willing to accept and which floods are unacceptable and build these reservoirs. This must be an element of consensus in the national security strategy - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera on Radio RMF FM.

title: Local Government Council meeting on the flood situation
description: President Andrzej Duda took part in a meeting of the Council for Territorial Self-Government. The meeting was devoted to the flood situation – possibilities of cooperation and support at the local government level. As the President said, the Head of the National Security Bureau is currently carrying out reconnaissance on his orders in the areas affected by flooding.

title: The President on the flood situation in southwestern Poland
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, announced that he would immediately go to the flood-affected areas when the period of danger ends, because – as he emphasized – his presence in that area now would distract the attention of rescuers. He also appealed for help for the residents of southwestern Poland.

title: Head of National Security Bureau: First humanitarian transport in the coming hours
description: "In the coming hours, as a result of the actions of the President of the Republic of Poland and the First Lady, the first humanitarian aid will be sent to one of the towns in Lower Silesia: 18 tons of drinking water, food, hygiene products, which are in short supply there," announced today on Polsat News the Head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, who, on the orders of the President of the Republic of Poland - the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces, is staying in the areas affected by the flood damage.

title: Racibórz. The head of the National Security Bureau on strategic investments in response to flood threats
description: On the President's orders, I came here, to Racibórz, to receive a complete set of information related to the condition of the Racibórz Dolny reservoir and the stage of preparations to counteract the wave that we expect in the near future - said Jacek Siewiera, Head of the National Security Bureau, at a briefing.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Press briefing of the Head of the National Security Bureau in Racibórz
description: Today, September 16, 2024 at 4:00 p.m., a briefing by the Head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, will be held at the front dam of the Racibórz Reservoir.

title: The President spoke with the Chief Commander of the State Fire Service
description: President Andrzej Duda spoke today with the Chief Commander of the State Fire Service, Senior Brigadier Mariusz Feltynowski.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau: The President is constantly informed about the flood situation
description: President Andrzej Duda is constantly informed about the flood situation, also at night; he receives reports on the course of events, the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera said at a briefing. He informed that the operational service is on duty at the National Security Bureau continuously.

title: Funeral ceremony of the commander of the Border Protection Corps
description: President Andrzej Duda took part in the reburial ceremony of the late Gen. Jan Kazimierz Kruszewski – commander of the Border Protection Corps in the years 1930-1939, whose ashes were brought from France to Poland in early September. This is an element of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the Border Protection Corps celebrated this year. The celebrations were held under the Honorary Patronage of the President of the Republic of Poland.

title: The head of the National Security Bureau on the situation beyond the eastern border: The truce will work to the benefit of the Russian Federation
description: "Ukrainians want lasting, stable peace guaranteed by the international community, not a truce, because it will work to the benefit of the Russian Federation" - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera, a guest of "Rozmowy Piaseckiego" on TVN24, about the situation beyond the eastern border.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Participation of the President of the Republic of Poland in the funeral ceremony of the commander of the Border Protection Corps
description: On September 12, 2024 (Thursday) at 11:00 a.m. in the Field Cathedral of the Polish Army, the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda will participate in the funeral ceremony of the late Brig. Gen. Jan Kazimierz Kruszewski - commander of the Border Protection Corps. The general's ashes were brought to the Homeland in early September 2024. The related ceremonies are part of the celebrations of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the Border Protection Corps.

title: Special awards from the President of the Republic of Poland and the Head of the National Security Bureau at the Kielce defence fair
description: On the last day of the XXXII International Defence Industry Exhibition in Kielce, the deputy head of the National Security Bureau, Lieutenant General Dariusz Łukowski, presented the award of the President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda for the best products aimed at improving the level of security of soldiers of the Polish Armed Forces, as well as the award of the Head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera, for innovation and the use of new technologies for security.

title: Head of BBN: information that there was nothing important in the files concerning Rubtsov is insufficient
description: The information that there was nothing important in the files from the Polish investigation into Pavel Rubtsov seems to be far from sufficient, stressed the head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera. He added that the intelligence officer treats such files as a source of "extraordinary knowledge".

title: Polish-Lithuanian Defense Sector Business Forum with the participation of the Presidents of Poland and Lithuania
description: The President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda and the President of the Republic of Lithuania Gitanas Nausėda opened the Polish-Lithuanian Defense Business Forum this morning. In the presence of the Presidents, a ceremony of signing a number of agreements on cooperation in the field of cybersecurity and defense industries also took place.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau at the Karpacz Forum: The EU should invest in proven defense solutions, NATO structures
description: The EU should invest in proven defence solutions and NATO structures, said Jacek Siewiera, head of the National Security Bureau, during the Economic Forum in Karpacz on Wednesday, when asked about building a European army.

title: Head of the National Security Bureau at the Forum in Karpacz: the EU fund for the eastern flank countries is a condition for deepening integration
description: As long as Brussels does not properly diagnose the threat within the 12 countries of the eastern flank and does not create a fund for the purchase of common equipment for them for joint operations, there can be no talk of deeper European integration, because it would be at Poland's expense - assessed the head of the National Security Bureau, Jacek Siewiera.

title: XXXII International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce
description: The President of the Republic of Poland Andrzej Duda visited the XXXII International Defence Industry Exhibition in Kielce. Opening the fair, the Commander of the Polish Armed Forces emphasised that increasing the level of defence expenditure and making the armies of NATO countries really strong will prevent another world war. The President was accompanied by the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera during the fair.

title: Polish Defence and Security Equipment Catalogue
description: On the first day of the XXXII edition of the International Defence Industry Exhibition in Kielce, the Minister of National Defence, Deputy Prime Minister Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and the Head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, presented the publication "Polish Defence and Security Equipment Catalogue". The catalogue was prepared by the National Security Bureau, in cooperation with the Ministry of National Defence and companies from the domestic defence sector. The aim of the catalogue is to support the promotion of the Polish arms industry on international markets.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: The heads of the Ministry of National Defense and the National Security Bureau will present a catalog of export solutions of the Polish arms industry
description: On Tuesday, September 3, 2024 at 11.15 a.m., at the International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera will present a catalog with the export offer of Polish defense companies.

title: Ceremony to commemorate the Heroic Defenders of Westerplatte
description: Westerplatte has become for us Poles a symbol of soldierly courage, determination and readiness to shed blood for our homeland. This special place reminds the whole world every year of the aggression of Nazi Germany, which the Polish state was the first to oppose with force. It also reminds us of the entire tragedy of World War II - the greatest in the history of our homeland, Europe and the world - which began with the attack on Poland - wrote the President of the Republic of Poland in a letter addressed to the participants of the ceremony commemorating the Heroic Defenders of Westerplatte on the 85th anniversary of the outbreak of World War II.

title: ANNOUNCEMENT: Visit of the President of the Republic of Poland at the defense fair
description: On September 3, 2024 (Tuesday) at 12:00, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, will visit the XXXII International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce.

title: Kyiv. President of the Republic of Poland at the celebrations of the 33rd anniversary of Ukraine's Independence
description: President Andrzej Duda visited Kyiv, where he took part in the celebrations of the 33rd anniversary of Ukraine's Independence. - Your Independence Day is, in a sense, also a celebration of the independence of all of Central Europe. Because without an independent Ukraine, it is difficult to think about an independent and safe Poland, Lithuania or other countries in our region - said the Polish leader during the main celebrations in Sofia Square.

description: Ostre strzelanie batteries MRC

description: Initial operational readiness of AN/ALQ-249 NGJ-MB pods

description: WZE starts production of Geonyx inertial navigation

description: Lubawa S.A. will deliver vests to the Police

description: Aselsan with a contract for equipment for new patrol boats
