description: Lockheed Martin podsumował dostawy F-35 Lightning II w 2024 roku

title: Elbit ReDrone anti-drone system for NATO country
description: System antydronowy Elbit ReDrone dla państwa NATO

title: The United States Department of Defense orders high-volume production of the AN/ALQ-25 system...
description: The United States Department of Defense orders large-scale production of the AN/ALQ-25 system...

title: Mine countermeasure package for LCS getting closer to being put into service
description: The mine-sweeping package for the LCS is getting closer to being accepted for use

title: Another batch of Freccia wheeled infantry fighting vehicles for Esercito Italiano
description: Another batch of Freccia wheeled infantry fighting vehicles for Esercito Italiano

title: Lithuania buys communication systems and drones from the United States
description: Lithuania buys communication systems and drones in the United States

title: The army does not want Borsuk? It was supposed to power the Polish arms industry, but it is still uncertain
description: In the shower of executive agreements that the military has concluded in the last weeks of 2024, one is missing. The big absentee is the new Borsuk combat vehicle. Its fate is being closely monitored, so the failure to sign the agreement raises many assumptions. Mostly bad ones.

title: German company increases stake in company that will produce artillery shells
description: German arms company Rheinmetall is taking over a 51 percent stake in Rheinmetall Defence Lietuva, which will build a new ammunition factory under a partnership agreement with the government.

title: Seven Pillars of Security: The Polish Presidency Faces an Important Challenge
description: Our ambition was to open the first cluster of accession talks with Ukraine during the Polish presidency, says Magdalena Sobkowiak-Czarnecka, Undersecretary of State in the Chancellery of the Prime Minister (European Union Division), in a conversation about the priorities of Polish and European security.

title: The prosecutor's office is opening an investigation into Antoni Macierewicz. It concerns one decision
description: The prosecutor's office has opened an investigation into the former head of the Ministry of National Defense, Antoni Macierewicz. It concerns the decision not to join Poland's initiative on aerial tankers.

title: Big concerns about the fate of new American fighters. What about the F-35?
description: Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, who are to co-head the Department of Government Efficiency, are calling for more investment in unmanned aerial systems, which could lead to changes in aviation weapons programs. At the same time, questions about the fate of the F-35 are being raised.

title: Police helicopters to undergo modernization. This is an important system
description: The Black Hawk helicopters belonging to the police will undergo modernization. The contract, worth over PLN 10 million, includes the installation of an important system: rotor de-icing. The police currently has five machines of this type in stock. Negotiations with the manufacturer ended on December 17, and the contract itself was signed a day later.

title: Ukrainian Patriots will gain heavy armor
description: As part of Rinat Akhmetov's Steel Front defense initiative, the Metinvest Group, which is owned by him, has manufactured and assembled armor protection for the control module of the MIM-104 Patriot system, which protects the Ukrainian sky from Russian enemy attacks. The first armors have already been installed by Metinvest engineers on the active air defense system.

title: The head of the Ministry of National Defense for WNP.PL. In one week we spent more on armaments than the entire European Union
description: Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defence, talks to WNP.PL about the government's and the Ministry of National Defence's actions regarding state security in 2025, the most important challenges facing the Ministry of Defence and the list of problems and financial shortages.

title: Putin has depleted the country's financial reserves. Russia faces a difficult year
description: The shift of the economy to war mode initially gave Russia a boost to growth, but now the country faces stagnation. Financial and personnel resources have been exhausted, Russian analysts note.

title: More and more questions about contracts with Korea. "There has never been such chaos"
description: The political crisis in South Korea is ongoing. The country with which we are tied by huge contracts for the purchase of weapons had three heads of state in December. And it does not look like the situation will end happily anytime soon. What next for Polish contracts and what does the future hold for Korea itself?

title: Market analysis regarding the rearmament of the ORP Ślązak corvette
description: On December 30, 2024, the Armaments Agency announced its intention to conduct Initial Market Consultations (IMC) regarding the retrofitting of the ORP "Ślązak" (241) patrol corvette, which remains in the inventory of the Polish Navy, with armament systems and additional equipment providing the capabilities to: engage surface and air targets with missile weapons, use and combat Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), conduct operations in the field of radar reconnaissance (WRE) and offer logistics and training packages for the above-mentioned scope of retrofitting. The condition set by the Armaments Agency is to perform the work in a shipyard located in the territory of the Republic of Poland.

title: Rescue ship for the Navy ordered
description: On 27 December this year, at the Naval Academy in Gdynia, in the presence of Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defence Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz, Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera and Deputy Minister at the Ministry of National Defence Paweł Bejda, a contract worth over PLN 1 billion gross was signed for the acquisition of a rescue ship for the Polish Navy under the programme codenamed Ratownik together with a logistical support package. This will be a support unit, which, thanks to its specialist equipment, will be intended in particular to provide rescue support for the operational activities of submarines. The parties to the contract are the Armaments Agency and the Consortium consisting of: Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa S.A., PGZ Stocznia Wojenna Sp. z o.o. and OBR Centrum Techniki Morskiej S.A.

title: Artyleria pod parasolem Force Protection
description: For the purpose of conducting reconnaissance and air cover of the area of ​​operations, the Armament Agency purchased a system package called Force Protection from WB Electronics on 24 December. Communication means and artillery calculators were also purchased under the contract.

title: More Crabs for the Polish Army
description: On 23 December this year, an executive agreement was signed between the Armament Agency and Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. for the delivery of another four Regina divisional fire modules (DMO), including 96 Krab 155 mm self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS). Half of the ordered Krabs are to be delivered in a modernized version, equipped with, among others, an automated magazine for projectiles and propellant charges and an automatic loader. Deliveries are planned for 2027-2029, and the total value of the agreement amounts to approx. PLN 9 billion gross.

title: K9 self-propelled gun-howitzers will receive Polish accompanying vehicles
description: On 23 December this year, an agreement was signed between the Armament Agency and the consortium consisting of Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa S.A. (leader), Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. and Rosomak S.A. for the acquisition of over 250 accompanying vehicles for 155 mm self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS) K9 Thunder. The order value amounts to nearly PLN 8 billion gross. The detailed scope of the agreement includes the delivery of accompanying equipment for nine AHS K9 divisional fire modules (DMO), supplied by the Polish defence industry, in 2027-2028.

title: Russian satellite program MikroGlob
description: On 20 December this year, the Armament Agency and Creotech S.A. signed an agreement for the delivery of the Earth Observation Satellite System under the MikroGlob program. According to the agreement, the Polish Armed Forces will acquire four micro-satellites based on the HyperSat platform developed by Creotech, equipped with optical instruments enabling the acquisition and transmission of Earth image data to the ground segment in the range of waves corresponding to the near-infrared and visible light bands. The value of the order amounts to approx. PLN 556.7 million gross, and the launch of the satellites and their achievement of low heliosynchronous orbit (SSO) is planned by 2027.

title: Radmor and Thorium Space Agreement
description: The WB Group Space Technology Center (operating within Radmor) and Thorium Space have signed a cooperation agreement. The agreement, announced on December 18, concerns the construction and development of various satellite platforms, their sensors, software, cryptographic and communication systems. This is another step by the Polish industry towards achieving technological sovereignty in the space industry.

title: Grottos and more – December contract of FB “Łucznik”
description: On December 19 this year, the Armaments Agency signed a multi-year contract with Fabryka Broni "Łucznik" - Radom (PGZ Group) for the supply of 5.56 mm MSBS Grot assault rifles, 40 mm under-barrel grenade launchers and 9 mm VIS 100 pistols.

title: Keel-laying ceremony for the sixth Project 258 minehunter
description: On 16 December this year, the Remontowa Shipbuilding S.A. shipyard in Gdańsk hosted a keel-laying ceremony for the sixth in a series of modern minehunters of the 258 project, the Kormoran II type. The ship, which will be named Czajka and has the side number 606, will be the last of three intended for the Świnoujście 12th Minesweeper Squadron of the 8th Coastal Defense Flotilla.

title: The last delivery from South Korea this year
description: On December 17, a ship from South Korea was unloaded in the port of Gdynia, which delivered: 7 K2GF tanks, 16 K9A1 self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS) and 6 Homar-K multiple rocket launcher (WWR) modules. These are the last deliveries of this type of military equipment from South Korea this year. As a result, the Polish Army has so far received a total of: 84 K2GF tanks (46.7% of the first implementation contract), 136 AHS K9A1 (64.1% of the first implementation contract) and 72 Homar-K WWR (33.0% of the first implementation contract). In the case of WWR launchers, it was possible to accelerate deliveries and today's is the second of those initially planned for 2025.

title: The first "Longs" will be delivered to the army
description: On 17 December this year, the Armaments Agency representing the State Treasury signed an agreement with a consortium consisting of Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. and Rosomak S.A. for the acquisition of 80 wheeled armoured personnel carriers Rosomak-L with an unmanned turret ZSSW-30.

title: Modernization of C-295M CASA aircraft
description: On 13 December this year, an agreement for the modernisation and unification of C-295M CASA transport aircraft for the Polish Army was signed between the Armament Agency and the Spanish company Airbus Defence & Space, in the presence of Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defence Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz. The modernisation planned for 2025-2033 will apply to all 16 C-295M aircraft owned by Poland and used by the 8th Air Transport Base in Balice. The value of the contract is EUR 102.7 million net (approx. PLN 540 million gross).

title: MQ-9B Sky Guardian UAV for the Polish Army
description: On December 12, 2020, the Armament Agency and General Atomics Aeronautical Systems Inc. concluded an agreement for the delivery of an unmanned aerial system (UAV) of the MALE (Medium-Altitude Long-Endurance) class, i.e. capable of performing flights at medium altitudes and over long distances, the MQ-9B Sky Guardian, which includes several unmanned aerial platforms. The value of the agreement for the delivery and comprehensive operation support service is approximately USD 310 million net (approximately PLN 1.525 billion gross). The delivery is to be completed by the first quarter of 2027.

title: Poland's defence spending in 2022-2025 according to the Ministry of National Defence
description: On December 5 this year, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz presented information on Poland's defense spending incurred in 2022-2023 and planned for 2024-2025 in the Sejm of the Republic of Poland. According to the head of the Ministry of National Defense, defense spending planned for 2025 is to be 60% higher than in 2023 and 2.5 times higher than in 2022, reaching 4.7% of Poland's GDP. In turn, the implementation of this year's defense spending in the state budget is currently to amount to 73%, while the implementation of spending from the Armed Forces Support Fund (FWSZ) by the end of this year is to reach 65%-70%. For comparison, the implementation of the FWSZ in 2023 amounted to approx. 50% of the plan.

title: Another $4 billion in US loans for military equipment purchases
description: On December 5, the Ministry of National Defense announced that Poland and the United States have concluded the fourth direct loan agreement under the FMF (Foreign Military Financing) program. The latest agreement concerns a loan in the amount of USD 4 billion (i.e. approx. PLN 16 billion at the current USD exchange rate). The funds obtained will be used to finance, among others, an agreement for the purchase of 96 AH-64E Apache helicopters and the Patriot air defense system (under the Wisła program).

title: An order for several hundred CD-10s fuel dispenser tanks
description: On December 4 this year, an agreement was signed between the Armament Agency and Celtech Sp. z o.o. for the delivery of several hundred to 320 CD-10s fuel dispenser tanks on the Scania P460 B6x6HZ chassis, primarily for the needs of the Armored and Mechanized Forces and the Rocket and Artillery Forces, including 105 units under the option right. The total value of the order for the guaranteed and optional part was set at approximately PLN 1.05 billion gross, and deliveries are to be made in 2026-2028. The tank holds up to 10 m3 of diesel oil, gasoline, or aviation fuels.

title: Launch of contracts for the supply of K9 gun-howitzers and Homar-K rocket launchers
description: On December 2nd this year, during a press conference attended by Deputy Minister Paweł Bejda, responsible for the technical modernization process at the Ministry of National Defense, and the Head of the Armaments Agency, Brigadier General Artur Kuptel, it was announced that on November 27th this year, Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego concluded a credit agreement worth EUR 4 billion, thanks to which it will be possible to finance in part net two executive agreements, concluded conditionally and providing for the delivery of 155 mm K9 Thunder self-propelled gun-howitzers together with ammunition (contract of December 1st, 2023) and Homar-K multi-rocket launcher modules together with missiles (contract of April 25th, 2024) to the Polish Armed Forces. Providing financing for the above-mentioned agreements allows for the physical launch of their implementation.

title: November deliveries of military equipment for the Polish Army
description: In November this year, the Polish Army received several deliveries of new military equipment. The delivered equipment included: two S-70i Black Hawk helicopters, 15 K2GF tanks, 12 K9A1 self-propelled gun-howitzers, 8 Homar-K multi-rocket launcher (MRL) modules, 2 Homar-A MRLs (HIMARS), 8 M120K Rak self-propelled mortars and 4 artillery command vehicles (AWD). Deliveries of S-70i helicopters completed the implementation of the contract from December 15, 2021, while deliveries of Rak and AWD mortars completed the implementation of the contract from May 22, 2020. At the end of November this year. It was also reported that the M1A1 FEP Abrams tanks previously delivered to Poland were delivered to the 1st Tank Battalion in Żurawica of the 19th Lublin Mechanized Brigade.

title: AIM-9X Sidewinder missiles ordered
description: On November 29, the head of the Armaments Agency, Brig. Gen. Artur Kuptel, signed a Letter of Acceptance with the United States government for the purchase of 232 AIM-9X Sidewinder Block II air-to-air missiles with a delivery date of 2028-2030. In addition to air combat assets, the contract includes additional elements, including spare parts, a logistics and training package. The value of the order is approximately USD 175 million net, or nearly PLN 876 million gross.

title: A new source for the production of explosives in Poland
description: At the headquarters of the Industrial Development Agency on November 26, a letter of intent was signed related to increasing the production capacity of the Nitroerg company. Both entities are to analyze the possibilities and investment scope of the project to create competences for the production of pentrite and hexogen at a plant in Silesia. In principle, the investment is aimed at securing the needs of the civil market for explosives.

title: Progress in the implementation of the Homar-A program
description: In the second half of November this year, talks were held in the United States regarding tank ammunition for M1 Abrams tanks and co-production of GMLRS missiles for Homar-A multiple launchers (MRL) in Poland. They were attended by a delegation from the Armament Agency led by the Deputy Head of this institution, Brig. Gen. Michał Marciniak, while the American side was represented by Patrick Mason, Deputy Secretary of the US Army for Export and Defense Cooperation. On November 22 this year, two M142 HIMARS launchers intended for training purposes, equipped with M68A2 training modules, were delivered to Poland. They are the last delivered element of the first Homar-A missile squadron ordered on February 13, 2019. In accordance with the framework agreement of September 11, 2023, Poland plans to order another 486 MRL Homar-A. We will discuss the current stage of implementation of this program later in the article.

title: Another FlyEye UAV ordered. The Drone Troops Inspectorate will be established.
description: On November 15, another executive agreement was signed between the Armament Agency and WB Electronics S.A. for the delivery of 13 sets of FlyEye mini-class unmanned aerial systems (UAVs) to the Polish Armed Forces this year, along with technical documentation and repair, logistics and training packages. One set includes 4 air platforms. The value of the agreement amounted to approximately PLN 97.5 million gross. The ceremony was attended by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and Secretary of State at the Ministry of National Defense Paweł Bejda, responsible for the technical modernization process. In his speech, Deputy Prime Minister Kosiniak-Kamysz informed, among other things, that from January 1, 2025, the "Droned Troops Inspectorate" will be established, which will be responsible for the implementation of unmanned systems in all types of the Polish Armed Forces.

title: The crawfish will receive accompanying vehicles
description: On November 8, 2027, the Armaments Agency, a consortium consisting of Polska Grupa Zbrojeniowa S.A. and Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. (leader) signed an agreement to acquire several dozen accompanying vehicles for three divisional modules of WR-40 Langusta multiple rocket launchers in 2027-2028. The order value amounts to PLN 1.320 billion gross.

title: The status of modernization of Leopard 2A4 tanks to the Leopard 2PL version
description: Almost nine years ago, on 28 December 2015, the Armament Inspectorate signed contract no. IU/77/X-89/ZS/NEGZ/USŁ/Z/2015/408 with the consortium of PGZ S.A. and ZM Bumar-Łabędy S.A. for the renovation and modernization of 128 Leopard 2A4 tanks to the Leopard 2PL version in 2018-2020 with an option to modernize 14 more tanks in 2021. The initial value of the contract was PLN 2.415 billion gross (without options). On 20 June 2018, Annex No. 2 to the aforementioned contract was concluded, which activated the option and extended the scope of work, without changing the order implementation period, as a result of which the value of the contract increased to PLN 2.721 billion gross. The current status of this order and how its completion date and value have changed are described later in the article.

title: A new source of financing for Polish ammunition production capabilities
description: On 31 October this year, the Ministry of State Assets submitted to the Standing Committee of the Council of Ministers a draft act on ensuring financing of activities aimed at increasing the production capacity of artillery ammunition in Poland. The document was published by the Government Legislation Centre (RCL) on 5 November this year. The draft provides for transferring funds of approximately PLN 3 billion to the Capital Investment Fund, which will be used to recapitalise companies responsible for the production of ammunition. The funds for this purpose are to come in the amount of PLN 2 billion from the budget of the Ministry of National Defence and in the amount of PLN 1 billion from treasury securities held by the Government Agency for Strategic Reserves.

title: WB Group in the AIDA project. Artificial intelligence in defense against cyberattacks
description: The WB Group is the only Polish company that is part of an international consortium implementing the Artificial Intelligence Deployable Agent project. The aim of AIDA is to develop possible scenarios and safeguards that would prevent cyberattacks on solutions based on artificial intelligence. The WB Group has the largest experience in Poland in the development of military AI systems.

title: Approval for the purchase of GCA-2000 mobile landing assistance systems
description: On November 1, the US Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) announced that the Department of State had granted consent for Poland to purchase L3Harris GCA-2000 (Ground Control Approach) radar landing assistance systems in a mobile version under the Foreign Military Sales (FMS) procedure. The announcement did not provide information on how many systems the Polish request concerns. It is only known that it was valued at a maximum amount of USD 105 million net, or approximately PLN 520 million gross. Previously, a total of 14 GCA-2000 sets in a stationary configuration were acquired for the needs of the Polish Army in the years 2004-2019, which were installed on the premises of individual air bases.

title: Additional bulletproof vests and helmets for the military
description: On October 24 this year, the Armament Agency and Lubawa S.A. concluded an annex worth approximately PLN 160 million gross to the agreement of March 31, 2023, the subject of which is the delivery of approximately 15,000 additional Gryf integrated bulletproof vests for the Polish Armed Forces in 2024-2025. The Armament Agency also announced that on April 7 this year, an annex was concluded to the agreement of March 8, 2023, between the Armament Agency and Maskpol S.A., worth approximately PLN 20 million gross for the delivery of another approximately 10,000 HP-05 composite helmets with deliveries by the end of this year. Both orders are part of the “Szpej” operation announced by the management of the Ministry of National Defense, the aim of which is to purchase modern individual equipment for soldiers.

title: Approval for MLU modernization of Polish F-16s
description: On October 23, the US Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) announced that it had granted the Department of State permission to carry out, under the Foreign Military Sales (FMS) procedure, the MLU (Midlife Upgrade) of 48 Polish F-16 C/D Jastrząb multi-role combat aircraft to version V (Viper). The total cost of modernization (including the purchase of necessary equipment, test and training weapons, and services) was estimated at a maximum of USD 7 billion net (approx. PLN 28.1 billion net), but it should be emphasized that part of the valuation concerns optional elements, all of which will certainly not be ordered in the end. This means that the value of the planned contract for the MLU modernization of Polish F-16s should be significantly lower than the given amount.

title: Overstatement of Poland's defence spending
description: During a press conference held on October 4 this year under the slogan "Polish Army 2024", Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz announced that Poland's defense spending "is at a record level", and this statement was illustrated by a slide showing the spending: in 2023 at the level of PLN 137.1 billion (3.9% of GDP), in 2024 PLN 158.8 billion (4.2% of GDP), and in 2025 PLN 186.6 billion (4.7%). Unfortunately, in reality we spend less on defence because the given values ​​referred only to the expenditure plan, and in addition, part of the defence expenditure incurred from the Armed Forces Support Fund (FWSZ) is counted twice, once for the payment of advances and deliveries of military equipment, and the second time for servicing the debt incurred to purchase this military equipment, i.e. for: commissions, interest, debt repayment and operating costs of the FWSZ. In the author's opinion, expenditure on servicing the FWSZ debt should not be included in defence expenditure, but in the part of the state budget related to debt servicing.

title: The sixth Kormoran II class minehunter is under construction
description: On October 15, 2022, the ceremonial commencement of sheet metal cutting for the sixth modern minehunter of the 258-class Kormoran II (construction number 258/6) project took place at the Remontowa Shipbuilding S.A. shipyard in Gdańsk. The ship will be the last of three units ordered under the agreement of June 26, 2022, worth PLN 2.5 billion gross, which are to enter service in 2026-2027 in the 12th Wolin Minesweeper Squadron of the 8th Coastal Defense Flotilla stationed at the Naval Port in Świnoujście. The name ORP Czajka and side number 606 have been planned for the ship. Its contractor is the Consortium consisting of: Stocznia Remontowa Shipbuilding S.A. together with PGZ Stocznia Wojenna Sp. z o.o. and OBR Centrum Techniki Morskiej S.A.

title: CAESAR fired at the Ustka training ground
description: An unusual guest was supposed to appear at the Central Air Force Training Ground in Ustka at the end of September. The French part of the KNDS concern informed about long-range fire tests of the CAESAR wheeled gun-howitzer using 155 mm ammunition – the tasks were carried out at a distance of "over 42 km". KNDS France sees our country as a future partner for joint production of ammunition.

title: FWSZ revenue and expenditure performance at the end of June 2024
description: This year, the Armed Forces Support Fund (FWSZ) operated by the Bank Gospodarstwa Krajowego had accumulated savings of PLN 7.785 billion at the beginning of the year, and the revenues planned for 2024 amounted to PLN 48.092 billion, including PLN 34.109 billion from debt mechanisms. By June 30 this year, the revenue plan was implemented at the level of 19.6% and just 3.6%, respectively. FWSZ expenditures in 2024 were planned at PLN 52.590 billion, of which PLN 45.875 billion were for the purposes specified in the "Armed Forces Development Program" (PRSZ). By June 30 this year, the expenditure plan was implemented at the level of 24.5% and 22.2%, respectively, allocating only PLN 10.197 billion for the technical modernization of the Polish Army. Total debt of FWSZ at the end of June this year reached the level of PLN 28.737 billion.

title: Draft budget for Poland's defence in 2025
description: On September 30 this year, the Sejm of the Republic of Poland received the draft budget act for 2025 prepared by the Council of Ministers. It planned state budget revenues in the amount of PLN 632.8 billion, a state budget expenditure limit of PLN 921.6 billion and a state budget deficit of no more than PLN 288.8 billion (7.3% of GDP). The total amount planned for defense next year from the state budget and the Armed Forces Support Fund (FWSZ) is PLN 186.5 billion, which is to constitute 4.7% of Poland's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) planned in 2025 (in the amount of PLN 3,973.1 billion) and 18.7% of the total expenditure of the state budget and FWSZ. This means an increase in the defense spending plan next year compared to the plan for 2024 by PLN 28.6 billion, i.e. 18.1%.

title: Korean deliveries update
description: The Korean contracts are being implemented, for which the formula of one-time smaller deliveries has been adopted. The Ministry of National Defense and the Armament Agency have adopted a policy that they will inform about each such delivery. In both cases, rightly so. One cannot complain that the Korean industry delivers equipment in even minimal, drip tranches to a country that is asking for accelerated deliveries. In the second case, the society expects information that the process of strengthening the Polish Army with weapons is underway. In October this year, there were two more deliveries covering K2GF tanks, K9A1 gun-howitzers and Homar-K launcher modules.

title: Why were FA-50 aircraft purchased?
description: On September 16, 2022, two executive agreements were concluded with the South Korean company Korean Aerospace Industries with a total value of USD 3.005 billion net (approx. PLN 14.6 billion gross) regarding the acquisition of 48 FA-50 Fighting Eagle light combat aircraft for the Air Force, including 12 FA-50GF (Gap Filler) bridging versions and 36 FA-50PL versions adapted to Polish requirements. All ordered FA-50GFs were delivered to Poland between July 9 and November 26, 2023, while the FA-50PLs were to be delivered in 2025-2028, according to the agreement. Since this purchase is still controversial, it is worth familiarizing yourself with some additional information on it, provided to the editorial office by the Air Force Inspectorate of the General Command of the Armed Forces.

title: Thermal imaging cameras for Rosomaks
description: The last Polish Rosomaks with Hitfist-30P turrets were delivered almost a decade ago, so the equipment had a chance to wear out, and along the way, vehicles with 30 mm guns delivered to the Polish Armed Forces in large numbers completed a demanding operational mission in Afghanistan. The optoelectronic equipment of Polish wheeled infantry fighting vehicles is old and worn out. On October 3 this year, the 4th Regional Logistics Base announced that it had resolved the tender for the delivery of Asteria thermal imaging cameras intended for this type of vehicle. The process of modernizing the Rosomaks M1/M1M is slowly moving forward.

title: Tender for millions of pieces of ammunition for training
description: The Armament Agency announced on October 1 this year the launch of a multi-range tender for the acquisition of blank ammunition for the Armed Forces. The military plans to acquire blank ammunition for small arms in the following calibers in the years 2025-2028: 5.56 mm, 7.62 mm wz. 43 ("eastern"), 7.62 mm (rifle "eastern"), 9 mm wz. 93 (Parabellum), 12.7 mm and cannon calibers: 23 mm and 73 mm. This is another attempt by the AU to meet the training needs of the Polish Army. The previous one was basically unsuccessful.

title: Polish Army 2024 - Ministry of National Defense press conference
description: On October 4 this year, the management of the Ministry of National Defense organized a press conference under the slogan "Polish Army 2024", during which the Ministry of Defense's achievements to date and some plans for further actions were presented. The conference was attended by Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of National Defense Władysław Kosiniak-Kamysz and all deputy ministers. Each participant discussed a different area of ​​​​activity for which he is responsible in the Ministry of National Defense. Among the many interesting pieces of information, it is worth paying special attention to the presented list of orders for military equipment, which is to be ordered this year.

title: Closer to Polish missiles for Homar-K
description: The issue of manufacturing in Poland corrected missiles for the Homar-K (K239 Chunmoo) launcher is gaining speed. It is not necessary to prove that this is a more crucial subject for capabilities than even manufacturing the missile modules themselves in our country. The Polonization of the 239 mm CGR-080 missiles has clearly accelerated, and even from a direction from which not everyone expected.

title: Nearly PLN 12 billion of American loan for the purchase of Apache helicopters
description: On October 1, 2019, the Ministry of National Defense announced that Poland and the United States had concluded the third direct loan agreement under the FMF (Foreign Military Financing) program. The latest agreement concerns a loan in the amount of USD 3.08 billion (i.e. almost PLN 12 billion at the current USD exchange rate). The funds obtained will be used to finance a contract for the purchase of 96 AH-64E Apache helicopters.

title: Warmate is the weapon of the Korean army
description: On October 2, the WB Group announced the signing of an agreement with the South Korean agency DAPA for the sale of Warmate 3 loitering ammunition to that country. The ceremony took place during the KADEX exhibition held in Gyeryongdae (south of Seoul).

title: Amsta system purchased by a foreign customer
description: WB Group has signed a contract for the delivery of the Amsta border and critical infrastructure protection system. The advanced Polish solution will go to a foreign user, who will be provided with security in an area of ​​several kilometers. The Amsta system, which uses seismic sensors, can detect violations of the protected zone by people and cars from a long distance, but also low-flying helicopters.

title: Will K9 gun-howitzers kill the Crab?
description: In social media, some analysts are saying that the orders for the delivery of South Korean 155 mm self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS) K9A1/PL Thunder will “kill” the Polish 155 mm AHS Krab. In this commentary, I will try to explain whether such opinions are justified.

title: Further deliveries of equipment from South Korea
description: On September 11 this year, it was reported that a ship entered the port of Gdynia, on board of which the following were delivered from South Korea for the needs of the Polish Army: 5 K2GF Black Panther tanks, 12 K9A1 Thunder self-propelled gun-howitzers (AHS) and 12 Homar-K (K239 Chunmoo) multiple rocket launcher (MRL) modules. The K2GF tanks will probably go to the tank battalion from Morąg of the 20th Bartoszyce Mechanized Brigade, the K9A1 gun-howitzers to the 1st DAS from Węgorzewo of the 1st Mazury Artillery Brigade (thanks to which the division will already be fully equipped with new guns), while the MRL Homar-K modules will be transferred to Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. for integration with Jelcz P882.57 chassis and the Polish Topaz command system.

title: MSPO 2024: Premiere of the Polish A-KIT integration kit for the IBCS system
description: During this year's MSPO trade fair, the Research and Development Center for Maritime Technology S.A. (CTM) presented for the first time the A-KIT integration kit developed by the company, which allows for the connection of Polish sensors and effectors to the American IBCS command system. This is the result of offset agreements concluded as part of Phase I of the Wisła program, as well as a subcontracting agreement of November 29, 2022 signed between CTM and Wojskowe Zakłady Łączności Nr 1 S.A. (WZŁ-1). Based on this contract, WZŁ-1 commissioned CTM to supply A-KIT integration kits in the Bystra radar version, which are to be installed in the MCC mobile communication nodes manufactured by WZŁ-1, which are part of the Polish configuration of the Patriot/IBCS system.

title: MSPO 2024: Premiere of the Sajna radar station
description: During the XXXII International Defence Industry Exhibition held in Kielce, PIT-RADWAR S.A. publicly presented for the first time the prototype of the Multifunctional Fire Control Radar (RWKO) Sajna. It was developed based on development work commissioned in December 2012 and is to be the basic sensor of the short-range ground-based air defence system Kr. Narew. Its role will be to detect, identify and track objects, as well as to initially guide anti-aircraft missiles to them. Initial tests of the radar are currently underway, after which it must still undergo qualification tests, the positive result of which will determine the possibility of concluding a contract for supplies by the Armament Agency.

title: MSPO 2024: Second implementation contract for FlyEye UAV
description: On September 4 this year, during the XXXII International Defense Industry Exhibition in Kielce, another executive agreement was signed for the acquisition of FlyEye mini-class Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAVs). The subject of the contract concluded between the Armament Agency and WB Electronics S.A., worth approximately PLN 24 million gross, is the delivery of six FlyEye UAV sets to the Polish Armed Forces in 2024-2026.

title: MSPO 2024: Air bases will receive new radars
description: On the second day of the MSPO trade fair in Kielce, i.e. on September 4 this year, the Armament Agency signed an agreement with the Spanish company Indra Sistemas S.A. to acquire fifteen airport area control radar systems (RKRL), codenamed Drawa, which are to replace the currently used AVIA-W radars of this type. The total value of the contract (including the option) amounts to approx. PLN 1.1 billion gross and assumes the delivery of 8 systems under the basic order and another 7 systems under the option right, with deliveries in the years 2025-2031.

description: Heavy IFV for the Polish Army

description: The final stretch

description: Soldiers win in voting for 2024 sportsman of the year

description: Veteran's Center Sums Up Another Year of Operations: 10 Years of Supporting Veterans and Their Families

description: From Hawks to Vipers

title: The Homeland Defense Act – Questions and Answers
description: The Homeland Defense Act – Questions and Answers

description: Running gendarme

title: Hungarians in Polish uniforms
description: Hungarians in Polish uniforms

title: The head of the National Security Bureau began a 4-day visit to the Baltic countries
description: The head of the National Security Bureau, Minister Jacek Siewiera, began a 4-day visit to the Nordic and Baltic countries today - Sweden, Finland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania. The talks are related to the urgent need to strengthen international cooperation in the Baltic region, which is key to NATO and EU security. Especially in the context of the intensification of Russia's hostile actions in the Baltic Sea.

title: Saint Florian's Cross for the late Kazimierz Leszczyński
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, posthumously awarded the Cross of St. Florian to the late Kazimierz Leszczyński, Honorary President of the OSP Michowice, for outstanding achievements in the implementation of tasks resulting from being a member of the volunteer fire brigade.

title: Head of National Security Bureau at the signing of the contract for "Rescuer"
description: "The Rescuer" is a unit without which no major Navy in the world can function. Meanwhile, no major country in the world whose security depends on the sea can exist without the Navy - emphasized the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera, who took part in Friday's signing of the agreement to acquire a rescue ship for the Polish Navy under the "Rescuer" program.

title: Minister Siewiera for Puls Biznesu: The political renaissance of the Baltic Sea
President for "Neue Zürcher Zeitung": Russia is not only flexing its muscles, but is also threatening Europe with aggression
description: NATO must react dynamically and anticipate the actions of its opponents. Russia is not only flexing its muscles, but also threatening Europe with aggression. However, it must feel that NATO is like an iron fist and that it will end very badly for it - said the President in an interview for the Swiss newspaper "Neue Zürcher Zeitung".

title: Meeting with the families of soldiers who died abroad
description: On the occasion of the upcoming Day of Remembrance of the Fallen and Deceased in Military Missions and Operations Outside the Country's Borders, the Presidential Couple met with the families of deceased soldiers.

title: The Presidential Couple at a Christmas wafer meeting with soldiers
description: The President of the Republic of Poland, Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces Andrzej Duda and his wife Agata Kornhauser-Duda took part in a Christmas Eve meeting in uniform at the 1st Transport Aviation Base in Warsaw.

title: Meeting with NATO Secretary General
description: President Andrzej Duda, at the invitation of NATO Secretary General Marek Rutte, took part in a working meeting of a group of leaders of the Alliance, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky and EU representatives, devoted to coordinating an urgent increase in military and economic support for Ukraine.

title: The Act on Population Protection and Civil Defense signed by the President of the Republic of Poland
description: On December 18, 2024, the President of the Republic of Poland, Andrzej Duda, signed the Act of December 5, 2024 on Population Protection and Civil Defense

title: BBN chief: emphasis on development of national defence capabilities
description: "(...) the emphasis should be placed primarily on the development of our own national defence capabilities and taking over both setting an example and leadership on the flank" - said the Head of the National Security Bureau Jacek Siewiera, who was a guest on Tuesday on the "Trójkąt Polityczny" programme broadcast by TVP Info.

title: A new contract for the delivery of four divisional fire modules sh KRAB
KTO ROSOMAK-L with ZSSW-30 for the Polish Army
04.12 Artillery Festival
description: On the day of Saint Barbara - the patron saint of artillery, we extend our best wishes to all artillerymen and rocketeers. May your actions always be precise, your decisions accurate, and every goal achieved. May your difficult and responsible mission always be met with due recognition, and may your professionalism,

title: Offer for sale of fixed assets – Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. Branch 1 in Stalowa Wola
The last company fire module RAK delivered by HSW
Another UMI 9.50 from HSW S.A. for the Polish Army
National Independence Day
description: November 11, 1918 is one of the most important dates in the history of Polish statehood. On that day, Marshal Józef Piłsudski became commander-in-chief of the Polish army, and an armistice was signed in Compiègne, France, which meant Germany's defeat in World War I. This balance of power…

title: Contract for accompanying vehicles for WR-40 Langusta signed
HSW S.A. in 1st place among Podkarpacie companies according to investment outlays of the Golden Hundred of Podkarpacie
Open Day at Huta Stalowa Wola S.A.
description: Huta Stalowa Wola S.A. invites you to an Open Day, during which the employer's offer for people who would like to use their knowledge and competences in work for the country's defense and security will be presented. Interested parties are asked to bring with them a current CV and

title: China's Currency Weakens Amid New Trade War With US, Yuan Responds to Trump's Return
description: Concerns about the growth prospects of the world's second largest economy, the strengthening of the dollar and the new occupant of the White House, who has made the introduction of tariffs on foreign goods - especially those from China - his campaign slogan. The yuan is facing many unfavorable factors that are dragging it down and is losing this fight for now. The sentiment among investors is also shown by the falling yields on Chinese bonds.

title: Fed man warns of market bubble
description: Lisa Cook of the Federal Reserve said that financial assets are overvalued and we should prepare for their collapse.

title: Zero credit zero, timid reductions and the death of WIRON. We sum up the year in mortgages
description: Apparent stabilization - this is how you can sum up 2024 on the mortgage market. For the first time in 3 years, interest rates remained unchanged, and slight corrections dominated price lists. However, the past year brought several important events for borrowers.

title: Lower Silesia on a Single Ticket? The Region Wants to Follow Germany's Lead
description: The German nationwide monthly ticket has proven to be a huge success. This solution has inspired not only ordinary people to change to the train, but also other countries and even individual regions to introduce similar tickets, such as Lower Silesia, which is also considering a similar solution.

title: A law that does not exist, legal chaos and conflicting opinions. Crypto-exodus, or regulations in Polish
description: The European Union regulates the cryptocurrency market, the company operating on it is already one of the largest tax payers in Lithuania, France is trying to attract entities from the industry. Meanwhile, Polish offices are issuing guidelines that are contrary to the law, referring to laws that do not exist, and proposing measures to convince domestic companies to leave the country.

title: Most companies plan to raise prices. "Consumption is strong, demand remains strong"
description: 57 percent of large and medium-sized companies plan to raise prices by 5-10 percent in the next 12 months - according to a study conducted by Grant Thornton.

title: Orlen's margin has stopped falling. The giant showed how its refineries could earn money
description: As Orlen reported, its model refining margin in the whole of 2024 was more than one third lower than that recorded in 2023. However, the company managed to stop its quarterly erosion.

title: The tax office changes its mind, but sets one condition. It concerns the costs of self-employed workers.
description: Expenses for additional benefits for the self-employed can be included in the costs of obtaining income, the tax office agrees to this, but on one condition - writes "Rzeczpospolita" on Wednesday.

title: Azoty wants to have a gunpowder factory. "It's a strategic investment"
description: The Azoty chemical group is working on a feasibility study for an investment in a nitrocellulose and multi-base powder factory in Poland. This will contribute to the country's security, but it will not save the fertilizer manufacturer - "Puls Biznesu" reported on Wednesday.

title: "Zrywki" in Biedronka are not always free. When do you have to pay for them?
description: From this year, in Biedronka you have to pay for plastic bags, so-called "tear-off" bags, intended for packing products sold loose. This is only necessary when they are not used for their intended purpose, e.g. for packing pre-packaged products.

title: Meta follows Musk's lead, introduces X-style community commentary
description: The Meta Group, which owns Facebook, among others, will get rid of fact checkers, and users will have a greater role in moderating services, just like on the X portal - the company's owner, Mark Zuckerberg, announced on Tuesday in a recording on the Meta website.

title: Euro bounces off support. Dollar strengthens again
description: The strength of the dollar did not allow it to break the line of 4.24 PLN per euro. The Polish currency remains under the influence of global factors and fluctuations in the euro-dollar pair.

title: Marciniak: The situation regarding money for PiS is clear
description: The situation related to the resolution of the National Electoral Commission on the adoption of the report of the PiS election committee is unambiguous - said on Wednesday the chairman of the National Electoral Commission Sylwester Marciniak. As he said, if the resolution had been unclear, the National Electoral Commission would not have issued a letter informing about the obligation to pay money to the party.

title: Patriotic scam. "GW": Who made money on the Dmowski Institute?
description: The sale of the building intended for the seat of the Dmowski Institute, finalized in June 2022, was a planned operation by a group of speculators led by a former tax official - writes "Gazeta Wyborcza" on Wednesday.

title: We travel more and more often by PKP Intercity trains. An increase of 33% from 2022
description: PKP Intercity trains carried 78.5 million passengers last year, which is 15 percent more than the previous year and 33 percent more than in 2022 - the carrier announced in a press release.

title: French Foreign Minister: The EU will not tolerate attacks on its borders
description: The European Union will not tolerate attacks on its borders, French Foreign Minister Jean-Noel Barrot said in an interview with France Inter radio on Wednesday, referring to US President-elect Donald Trump's statements regarding Greenland.

title: Orlen will set a new course. "A strategic ocean of opportunities"
description: Thanks to the updated strategy, Orlen will set a new course: rational transformation and business acceleration - writes the president of the concern Ireneusz Fąfara in Wednesday's "Rzeczpospolita". We are starting 2025, sailing out into the ocean of new challenges - he adds.

title: Bloody year on Polish roads. Almost 1,900 people died in 21,500 accidents
description: Last year, there were over 21.5 thousand road accidents, in which 1,881 people died and over 24.8 thousand were injured - informed PAP Senior Commissioner Robert Opas from the Road Traffic Office of the Police Headquarters, citing preliminary data for 2024.

title: Engels under Ukrainian fire. Drones attack fuel depot, fire breaks out
description: Ukrainian drones attacked a fuel depot in the city of Engels in the Saratov region in western Russia; a fire broke out there and about 25 strong explosions were heard, the independent Russian channel Astra on Telegram reported on Wednesday morning. Engels is home to a Russian strategic aviation base.

title: The temperature at work has inflamed the government. There is no consent to change the regulations
description: Complicated, unrealistic, paralyzing companies and even threatening state security - these are some of the reservations of the ministries regarding the regulations regulating temperature in the workplace, proposed by the Ministry of Labor - reports "Dziennik Gazeta Prawna".

title: Mexico to the Rescue of Cuba. It Will Increase Oil Exports by 43.5 Percent
description: Cuba, which has been in an energy crisis for several months, is receiving increasing supplies of crude oil from Mexico. Between January and October alone, they increased by 43.5 percent.

title: The Polish presidency will promote itself with... apples. The ministry has ordered over 82 thousand of them.
description: The Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development has ordered over 82,000 apples for meetings organized as part of the Polish presidency of the Council of the European Union - the Ministry of Agriculture informed PAP. Polish apples have become the official fruit of the presidency and will be served to participants of the events.

title: Nvidia dragged down stock market indices
description: Tuesday's session on Wall Street ended with significant declines in the main indices. Nasdaq lost almost 2%. The leader of the declines was Nvidia, which led the increases the day before.

title: The government is pouring money into the arms industry. Half a billion will flow to the "Narew"
description: The Ministry of State Assets has recapitalized the Polish Armaments Group, which is responsible for the modernization programs of Poland's defense capabilities, with an amount of PLN 478 million - reports Wednesday's "Rzeczpospolita".

title: Will Canada Become Part of the US? Trudeau: Zero Chance
description: There is not the slightest chance that Canada will become part of the United States, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau wrote on social media on Tuesday, commenting on statements by American President-elect Donald Trump about the annexation of Canada.

title: PIP: over PLN 54 million went to collectively dismissed PKP Cargo employees
description: Following an inspection by the National Labor Inspectorate, over PLN 54 million has already been paid to collectively dismissed PKP Cargo employees, PIP head Marcin Stanecki told PAP. The inspection at the company focused on cases of non-payment of due wages and other benefits.

title: Kosovo is the poorest country in the Balkans
description: Kosovo remains the poorest country in the Balkans, with the highest unemployment rate in the region - according to the World Bank's findings, presented on Tuesday by Kosovo's RTV21 television.

title: Undersea cables under NATO's care. The alliance will send 10 ships
description: Around 10 NATO ships will take part in a mission to protect underwater infrastructure in the Baltic Sea. They will sail close to cables and other installations to reduce the risk of further acts of sabotage in the region. The first ships will appear at sea at the end of the week, and the operation is expected to last until April, Finnish radio Yle reported.

title: China prepares ground for 'vaccine diplomacy'
description: The PRC authorities are promising some countries priority access to Covid-19 vaccines developed by Chinese companies or are offering them loans to buy the desired doses. Some commentators are seeing this as the beginning of Beijing's "vaccine diplomacy."

title: Dom Development sold 995 units net in Q3, up 6% YoY.
description: Dom Development Group sold 995 net apartments in the third quarter of 2020, which means an increase of 22 percent QoQ and 6 percent YOY - the developer informed in a press release. During this time, the Group delivered 692 apartments to clients, which is 18 percent less than a year earlier.

title: Yanok Mortgage Fund on the KNF warning list
description: The Yanok Mortgage Fund has been added to the KNF's public warning list, the Polish Financial Supervision Authority announced on Friday. This includes accepting cash deposits in order to expose them to risk.

title: BM PKO BP is the leader in turnover on the WSE stock market in September
description: In September 2020, BM PKO BP returned to the position of the leader in turnover on the stock market in GPW session transactions. The leader of the August ranking, Merrill Lynch, took second place - GPW reported on its website.

title: Still no Brexit deal
description: The European Union and Great Britain have not yet reached an agreement on the principles of trade between the countries - Łukasz Ambroziak, an expert from the Institute of Agricultural and Food Economics, told PAP. The United Kingdom is Poland's third largest trading partner, and in the case of food - the second.

title: Prime Minister: We are repairing and building thousands of kilometers of roads
description: We repair thousands of kilometers of roads, renovate, modernize, but also create new roads in all corners of Poland - said Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki during the opening of the road in the Wielkopolska province.

title: Austria has entered the second wave of the coronavirus epidemic
description: Austria has entered a "second wave" of coronavirus infections, Prime Minister Sebastian Kurz said on Sunday, drawing attention to the growing number of positive tests.

title: A difficult general knowledge QUIZ. Only the best will get 10/10. Will you be one of them?
description: Are you ready to test your knowledge of various fields of science? This quick general knowledge quiz will allow you to test how much you know. We have prepared 10 questions that cover topics from various scientific topics, including: literature, geology, physics, medicine, geography and chemistry. Will you score a full set of points? Test your knowledge!

title: Kurski hit out at Nitras. "No drugs or filing." The Minister of Sport responded
description: Jacek Kurski clashed with the Minister of Sports on social media. The former head of TVP used harsh words against Sławomir Nitras. The latter did not owe him anything and quickly responded in a blunt manner. And the whole storm was unleashed by the civic candidate for President of the Republic of Poland and President of the Institute of National Remembrance Karol Nawrocki.

title: 15 million drivers must go to the office. New obligation adopted
description: Drivers have a new obligation imposed on them by the amendment to the regulations. Do you have such a driving license? Up to 15 million people must go to the office. When should you submit an application for replacement? The deadlines have already been set.

title: Up to PLN 17,000 for winter break for students. Check what conditions must be met!
description: The LOTTO Foundation named after Halina Konopacka has organised a competition "odLOTTOwe ferie 2025", in which you can receive funding of PLN 10,000 or PLN 17,000 for the organisation of stationary winter camps for primary school students. The offer is addressed to rural and urban-rural communes with up to 30,000 inhabitants.

title: Do you remember these cars from the Polish People's Republic? Score 8/10 only for experts
description: They were capricious, and their comfort was inferior to that of Western designs. Cars from the PRL are now a symbol of a bygone era, and nostalgia does not allow us to forget about them. Syrena, Fiat 125p, Nysa, Żuk - models once produced in thousands and millions of copies are now a real rarity on the roads. This quiz is a short journey back in time. How much do you know about motorization from the PRL era? A score above 8 points means that you are a real expert!

title: Forget about the declaration? You will pay a fine. This is the duty of every driver
description: It's not just the purchase of a car that gives rise to important obligations. In some situations, the sale of a car must be included in the PIT declaration submitted to the tax office. Drivers who forget to do this risk being fined thousands. The tax office will check whether the tax has been paid. Who has to remember it?

title: A dangerous virus has reached Europe. Fears of another pandemic
description: The presence of the HMPV virus, which is spreading very quickly in China, has been confirmed in Portugal. The virus manifests itself with symptoms similar to the flu and is particularly dangerous to children. Hospitals in China are overwhelmed, and the pathogen itself arouses great fear. What is known about it?

title: Ziobro stood up for Stoch. According to him, he is better than Małysz
description: Kamil Stoch has the best years of his sports career behind him. Our champion withdrew from the Four Hills Tournament, because in his current form he had no chance for a decent result. More and more often there are voices that he should retire. Jan Ziobro defends Stoch. The former Polish representative emphasizes that the 37-year-old deserves greater recognition and respect.

title: Good news for debtors. Bailiff will leave more in the account [NEW LIMITS]
description: From January 1, 2025, people in debt can breathe a sigh of relief. The amount free from bailiff seizure has increased to PLN 3,499.50, which is 75 percent of the minimum wage.

title: Jerzy Owsiak revealed that he received death threats. "Threats with a bomb in the background and disposal of my person"
description: Like every year, at the end of January, the Great Orchestra of Christmas Charity will play for the 33rd time. Unfortunately, the organizer of this great charity event, Jerzy Owsiak, is the subject of attacks. He fears for his safety. In a powerful post, he also referred to the tragic death of Paweł Adamowicz.

title: "Patriotic scam", homeless "a front". Who made money on the Dmowski Institute?
description: The sale of the building intended for the headquarters of the Dmowski Institute, finalized in June 2022, was a planned operation by a group of speculators led by a former tax official. The "front man" turned out to be a homeless man - reports "Gazeta Wyborcza" on Wednesday in an article titled "Patriotic Scam".

title: How Much is Gift Tax in 2025? New Limits Already in Force
description: A gift, like an inheritance, is subject to mandatory tax. Receiving an apartment, money or valuable items involves the need to settle accounts with the tax office. The amount of gift tax depends on the relationship, as well as the market value of the inheritance. Who must pay gift tax and what is the tax-free amount in 2025?

title: Norwegian ski jumper works as a night porter at a hotel
description: Benjamin Oestfold struggled with such serious financial problems. The Norwegian ski jumper, who thanks to good results in the Continental Cup was called up at the last minute to the Four Hills Tournament, is not afraid of any work. The 23-year-old recently worked in a factory, and recently took a job at a hotel as a night porter.

title: Iga Świątek will be lying on the beach before the Australian Open
description: Iga Świątek started her season by competing in the United Cup tournament. The competition in Sydney, where the Polish tennis team took second place, was very exhausting. That is why now the Polish player will lie on the beach to rest physically and mentally. "Before the Australian Open, Iga needs to regenerate" - emphasizes in an interview the coach of the vice-leader of the WTA ranking, Wim Fissette.

title: Functional illiteracy is on the rise. Sweden is phasing out laptops from schools and going back to paper
description: The Swedish government has declared a reading crisis, which it wants to combat, among other things, by returning to traditional textbooks and libraries instead of digital tools. Research shows that young Swedes have trouble understanding more complex texts, and universities are having to give up longer descriptions.

title: Recalculation of pension. Which age groups can gain even several hundred zlotys?
description: Does the amount of your pension not meet your expectations? It is possible to increase the benefit by submitting an application for recalculation to the Social Insurance Institution. This option is especially available to people born in certain years. Here are the details.

title: Below 18 degrees in school? When must classes be canceled? [REGULATIONS]
description: The issue of minimum temperature in schools raises questions especially in the autumn-winter period. Parents, teachers and students wonder what are the limits below which classes must be canceled. The regulations clearly regulate this issue, and in exceptional situations remote learning may be introduced.

title: These are the most congested cities in Poland. It's scary to go out on the road
description: Warsaw, Wrocław or Kraków are the most congested cities in Poland? It turns out that none of these metropolises even come close to the inglorious winner of the latest TomTom Traffic Index ranking, which was obtained by dziennik.pl. This Polish city is among the 10 worst in the world…

title: It earned 350 million. The cinema megahit will finally hit the Polish VOD platform
description: "Alien: Romulus", the latest installment of the cult science fiction series, quite unexpectedly turned out to be one of the biggest cinema hits of 2024. In November, news broke that the superproduction would hit Disney+ on November 21. And yes, it did. But not in Poland. However, in January it will finally happen. When exactly?

title: A tough quiz from the capitals of the world. Only a champion can get 12/12. Are you in this group?
description: Here's a new quiz on the capitals of the world. You'll probably wake up in the middle of the night and say that Rome is the capital of Italy and Berlin is the capital of Germany. However, some countries can test a little more. Can you answer all the questions correctly? Only geniuses will get 12 points. Good luck!

title: Do this simple ritual. You will attract money and wealth
description: This is a folk superstition that supposedly always works. It is supposed to ensure prosperity and good luck in finances. It will ensure that the person who does it will not lack money and prosperity. What exactly is it about?

title: The long-awaited Polish series is here. "It will keep you in suspense and make you think"
description: One of the most anticipated Polish series of this year has appeared on the Netflix platform, "Wzgórze pies" based on the novel by Jakub Żulczyk. The main roles will be played by Robert Więckiewicz and Mateusz Kościukiewicz, accompanied by Jaśmina Polak and Wojciech Zieliński. It promises to be a hit.

title: New obligation for owners of houses, apartments and hotels. Check if the changes also apply to you
description: From the end of December 2024, new regulations have been in force imposing the obligation to install smoke and carbon monoxide (CO) detectors in apartments, rented houses, rooms and places of accommodation. However, not all buildings must be equipped with them from 23 December 2024. Who does this obligation apply to and from when? You will find out in this article.

title: Mazda Changes Style and Technology: Here's a New SUV to Replace the CX-5
description: The new Mazda CX-5 will change not only its appearance and proportions. The manufacturer from Hiroshima is also focusing on proprietary drive solutions that will surprise when combined with combustion engines. In addition, the Japanese are building their own gigafactory. What can drivers expect?

title: The End of the Era of Affordable Housing? Prices Are Rising Despite Sales Falling. What's Happening?
description: In the fourth quarter of 2024, developers in the six largest markets in Poland sold 9.6 thousand apartments, which means an increase of 4.9% compared to the previous quarter - according to data from JLL. Despite this positive result, the total number of apartments sold in Poland last year did not exceed 40 thousand, which means a decrease of 31% year-on-year.

title: Massive fire in Los Angeles' celebrity district, 30,000 residents evacuated
description: Dantesque scenes unfold in a celebrity-filled Los Angeles neighborhood as firefighters battle a brush and tree fire in Pacific Palisades. The blaze spread to 510 hectares in a matter of hours Tuesday. 30,000 residents were ordered to evacuate due to life-threatening conditions.

title: Potato doughnuts from Ewa Wachowicz. An alternative to the classic ones.
description: Carnival is a time of doughnuts, angel wings and all kinds of sweets that are associated with this time. Ewa Wachowicz suggests potato doughnuts. Sounds a bit strange? Maybe, but how does it taste.

title: Luna complains about her rich parents. "Their financial status interferes with my career"
description: Singer Luna is the daughter of millionaire Andrzej Wielgomas, founder and owner of the Dawtona company. Last year's representative of Poland at Eurovision claims that, contrary to appearances, she has more troubles than benefits from her parents' wealth.

title: Here's a new whip for drivers. Important changes coming in January 2025
description: A new whip for drivers. In January, a system will be launched that will allow employers to automatically check employees' driving licenses every day at 6:00. The Ministry of Digital Affairs announces 100% effectiveness of checks.

title: The star of "Sexmission" has died. The actress was struggling with a serious illness
description: The news of Mirosława Marcheluk's death spread through the media on Tuesday (January 7) evening. The theater and film actress was 86 years old. She played in such productions as "Wodzirej", "Seksmisja", and "Zezowate szczęścia". In the last years of her life, she was said to have been struggling with a serious illness.

title: Rafał Patyra on TV Republika mocks Artur Orzech's late fatherhood. He said this
description: Artur Orzech recently happily announced that he will become a father for the second time. On the morning show of TV Republika, Rafał Patyra commented on the reports. No, there were no congratulations. There was criticism, however.

title: Sensational discovery of the Border Guard. Maseratis, Porsches and Lotuses worth millions
description: Exotic cars worth millions will be returned to their owners thanks to the coordinated work of the services. Polish officers, in cooperation with Italian law enforcement, have cracked a gang involved in the theft of luxury vehicles. The list of recovered cars includes Porsche, Lotus, Maserati and BMW.

title: The transfer hit in Ekstraklasa may "fall apart" on the final stretch
description: He was already in the garden, he was already greeting the goose, but as it turns out, the big transfer hit of the Polish Ekstraklasa may fall apart on the final stretch. Leonardo Rocha was supposed to swap Radomiak Radom for Raków Częstochowa. However, according to the latest information, this transaction will probably come to nothing.

title: Changes in "Halo, tu Polsat"! A new host is to join the team. Viewers love him!
description: There are reports in the media that something new is coming to the breakfast program "Halo tu Polsat". There will be changes in the team of presenters of this morning broadcast. A presenter will appear, whom viewers liked to watch in "Pytanie na śniadanie".

title: Tragic shooting in Germany. Manhunt for perpetrator underway
description: A tragic shooting took place in Bad Friedrichshall in Baden-Württemberg on Tuesday evening. As a result of the attack, two people died and one was seriously injured and is in critical condition.

title: The Ultimate History Quiz. Do You Remember These Dates? Anything less than 8 is embarrassing
description: Did you pay attention in history class? Do you remember these dates? Do you remember these events? Test yourself! A score of 10/10 is easy to achieve.

title: Will Greenland Become Part of the US? Trump Does Not Rule Out the Use of Force
description: Donald Trump Jr., the son of former US President Donald Trump, landed in Nuuk, the capital of Greenland, on Tuesday, drawing much interest from the local community. His visit, although presented as private, has sparked political commentary and speculation.

title: Poland is ahead of agriculture. Only Romania is ahead of us
description: Poland ranks second in the European Union in terms of the number of farms, second only to Romania, according to the latest Eurostat agricultural census. The data also shows that Poland stands out in terms of the share of land owned directly by farmers.

title: Romanowski will not lose all benefits from the Sejm. Hołownia says what next
description: New information in the case of Marcin Romanowski. He will not lose all his benefits from the Sejm. - PiS MP Romanowski will not receive a parliamentary allowance; he is not entitled to a salary. He will continue to receive a lump sum for maintaining his parliamentary office - said Sejm Marshal Szymon Hołownia.

title: Anna Lewandowska honored. She will receive the Medal of St. Brother Albert
description: Anna Lewandowska will be awarded the Medal of St. Brother Albert. The distinction goes to people who dedicate themselves to activities for people with disabilities. The medals will be presented during the 25th Albertiana Festival.

title: He went to the mountains with his child during a hurricane. TOPR sounds the alarm
description: A man with an eight-year-old child went to the mountains during a hurricane. The tourists got stuck on Pośrednia Turnia in the Tatras. Help was needed. - They were both very hypothermic and couldn't get down even with the help of a rescuer. It was necessary to set up a heated tent - informed the TOPR duty rescuer.

title: Serious accident in Słup Pierwszy. A block of ice from a truck injured a woman
description: A dangerous incident occurred in Słup Pierwszy (Borowie commune) at around 11:05 a.m. A block of ice broke off the roof of a moving truck and hit an oncoming Volkswagen. The ice broke through the vehicle's windshield and injured the passenger, who was transported to hospital with serious facial injuries. What are the consequences for not clearing snow from the vehicle?

title: Adam Nawałka will once again lead the Polish national team. He has already sent out call-ups
description: Adam Nawałka will return to the coaching bench of the Polish national team. The former coach of our team will lead the white and reds in the exhibition match Poland - Brazil with the participation of football legends of both countries.

title: Warning, glass on the roads! Weather forecast for Wednesday and Thursday
description: What will the weather be like on Wednesday and Thursday, January 8 and 9? Poland will be in the range of a low with a center over southern Scandinavia. Cooler maritime polar air will flow in. Rain and sleet are predicted, locally snow. Black ice is possible.

title: Polish-German cooperation enters a new level. In the background, the fight against illegal migration
description: Since the beginning of 2025, the fourth Polish-German border service cooperation facility has been operating in Tuplice, Lubuskie Province. This joint venture of Polish border guards and German federal police officers aims to strengthen activities in the field of combating international crime and other cross-border threats, such as illegal migration. Information about the opening of the unit was provided by the spokesman of the Nadodrzański Border Guard Unit, Lt. Paweł Biskupik.

title: The sixth anniversary of the death of Paweł Adamowicz. Gdańsk will honor the memory of the tragically deceased president
description: Gdańsk is planning to mark the sixth anniversary of the death of Paweł Adamowicz. The planned events include the unveiling of a commemorative plaque at the European Solidarity Centre, the presentation of the Paweł Adamowicz Award, and an interfaith prayer at St. Mary's Basilica. The celebrations will begin on January 13.

title: She Added Poison to Christmas Cake. She Wanted to Get Rid of Her Mother-in-Law. Three People Are Dead
description: Six people were taken to hospital in the Brazilian city of Torres with symptoms of severe food poisoning. Three of them died. Arsenic was found in their bodies. A 42-year-old woman who probably added the poison to the cake was arrested. The woman had a long-standing conflict with her mother-in-law.

title: Changes to accident insurance premiums in 2025. Check if it applies to your company?
description: From January 1, 2025, a new Polish Classification of Activities (PKD 2025) is in force in Poland, which has a significant impact on the method of determining the amount of the accident insurance contribution. Entrepreneurs, both those who started their business before 2025 and those who do so after that date, will have to adapt to the new rules.

title: PLN 60 billion for the construction of the first nuclear power plant. The government has made a decision
description: The government has approved a draft law providing for the transfer of PLN 60.2 billion in public support for the Polish Nuclear Power Plants company. These funds are to be allocated to the construction of the first nuclear power plant in Poland. Financing will cover the years 2025-2030.

title: This is how much money you can withdraw from an ATM at one time [LIMITS]
description: Although online banking has revolutionized the way we manage our finances, cash still has its place in our lives. ATMs, as the easiest way to access cash, have their limitations. Why can't we withdraw any amount? What are the withdrawal limits and are they the same across all banks? Here are the details.

title: A German corporation has taken control of the Polish port operator in Szczecin.
description: Rhenus Group has bought over half of the shares of the Polish port operator Bulk Cargo - Port Szczecin. As a result, it has become the majority shareholder of this company.

title: Key Korean investment in Poland. Production to start this year
description: The construction of a new factory for electric vehicle parts of the South Korean concern POSCO International is nearing completion. The new plant will produce components for Hyundai and Kia cars. Production is to start this year

title: Important NATO mission in the Baltic Sea. A team of 10 warships will go to sea
description: Around 10 NATO ships will take part in a special mission in the Baltic Sea. The first ships will be at sea by the end of the week, and the operation is expected to last until April.

title: UK economy back on the brink of collapse? Debt servicing costs at highest in almost 30 years
description: British bond yields have risen to their highest level since 1998. This means that the cost of servicing the British state's debt is rising rapidly - writes CNBC. Will the bond market crisis lead to a political earthquake like in 2023, when then-Prime Minister Lizz Truss was dismissed?

title: Does this send shivers down some of your spines? The military is coming for you. It's going to start in less than a month
description: Since there has been a war on our eastern border, such a call sends shivers down the spines of young people. Like every year, the army will check who is fit to be a soldier. It must have in reserve those who it will take into its boots. Qualification committees decide who can be drafted into the army if necessary.

title: What does the change of government in Germany mean for Poland? Expert has no illusions
description: What awaits Polish-German relations after the early parliamentary elections? Dr. Agnieszka Łada-Konefał from the German Institute for Polish Affairs has no great illusions...

title: Donald Trump Does Not Rule Out Using Force Against Denmark and Panama. The President-Elect's Terrifying Ideas
description: President-elect Donald Trump said he could not rule out the use of force to achieve his goals of control over Greenland and the Panama Canal. He also announced a name change for the Gulf of Mexico...

title: A revolution in the use of photovoltaics. Free electricity from the sun in a new way. Important changes have come into force for owners of solar panels
description: They have become a real hit in Poland. For several years now, there has been a boom in the installation of home installations for the production of electricity. The problem is that investing in free electricity from the sun is becoming more and more expensive. Will the amendment to the Renewable Energy Sources Act, which came into force on December 27, change this? The new regulations bring prosumers back to a settlement system based on the average monthly price of electricity.

title: They made a fool of the owners of gas and oil furnaces with money. Is this a scandal that could end in a court war?
description: Those who bought gas and oil furnaces were fooled. Why? Because until the end of last year, they could have withdrawn the money invested in the purchase, installation and connection of such boilers from the tribute due to the tax office. Now it turns out that at the beginning of 2025, such boilers disappeared from the list of expenses covered by tax relief. Will the owners of gas and oil furnaces go to court? The point is that an error was made in the regulations.

title: This has never happened before! Polish company takes over German giant. This is a deal worth billions
