description: The whole series of sad news about our companies being taken over by foreign corporations makes me want to cry. Now, finally, there is some optimism. A Polish company is buying a German giant. The transaction concerns the tourism industry that generates billions of euros in profits every year.

title: Changes are coming to the Polish labor market in 2025. And it's not good news
description: Slower wage growth, accelerated automation and artificial intelligence, visible wage brackets and a persistent staff shortage – these are the key trends that employers and employees will face in 2025. The year that is ending has brought a lot of changes and uncertainty, which has left its mark on the labor market. Personnel Service has taken a closer look at the main phenomena to assess which of them will dominate the next year and which are only temporary.

title: 600 plus for dentistry from the new year. Big change in dental treatment "on the National Health Fund" What to do to get this money?
description: Those who can't afford it have ruin in their mouths, those who have money spend a fortune in a private office, where the prices are jaw-dropping. This is what dental treatment looks like in our country. And few people know that paying a health insurance contribution means that we don't always have to pay for everything. This year there has been a big change in the basket of dental benefits under the National Health Fund. You can get 600 plus for a dentist.

title: Is this how you make a profitable bank deposit from Employee Capital Plans? There is a simple way to outsmart the system
description: Will future retirees no longer live in poverty? The Employee Capital Plans system is a safeguard in old age. This long-term savings program, which is made up of employers, the state and employees themselves, was launched over four years ago. Now it turns out that some have treated it as a simple way to make money. PPK have become a short-term... bank deposit, but with a profit that is many times greater.

title: A notarial deed does not protect the seller of real estate. How to get around this loophole in the law?
description: Theoretically, a purchase-sale transaction for an apartment, house or plot of land concluded before a notary protects both parties. Few people realize that the lack of one important record in the document can cost the seller not only the loss of rights to the property, but also the money from its sale. So how can the seller protect themselves and their property from dishonest buyers?

title: The biggest tax hits and misses. Ruthless analyses by renowned experts. Optimism mixed with pessimism
description: As experts on the subject argue, the past year brought few tax changes for companies. On the other hand, the postponement of the implementation date of the National e-Invoice System (KSeF), which was to be in force from mid-2024, is primarily received positively. The advantages also include a lower VAT rate in the beauty industry, cash PIT for the smallest companies and the minimum CIT tax. The latter is also on the list of disadvantages. Next to it, you can see, among others, the property tax or the act increasing the excise tax rate on tobacco products.

title: What was the real cost of Brexit? In trade alone, it is big. There are new calculations
description: Despite the fall in trade, the LSE study found that the overall impact of Brexit on the UK economy was more limited than originally forecast. However, the costs of divorce were still huge and are still being counted

title: Poland wants to save Ukraine. Can we afford to send increasingly expensive electricity?
description: Poland intends to save Ukraine if it starts to run out of electricity. The Minister of the Environment, Paulina Hennig-Kloska, has not ruled out an almost immediate increase in electricity supplies to our eastern neighbor, if the need arises. Is our country ready for this and will there be enough electricity in Poland to save our neighbor?

title: The Myth of the Unhappy Employee Debunked: Why Do We Think People Don't Like Working?
description: Most people feel satisfied with their work. Interestingly, however, they believe that others are dissatisfied in this area. The media promotes the myth of the unhappy employee, but it is untrue. At least in the US - we read on the Psychology Today website.

title: Another Country Is Fed Up with Platform X and Elon Musk: "They Can't Interfere in Countries' Internal Affairs"
description: Social media platforms like Elon Musk's X should be "completely neutral" and must not interfere in the internal affairs of countries, Spanish government spokeswoman Pilar Alegria said on Tuesday.

title: Do you like a glass of red wine? Doctors have some bad news for you
description: Consuming a glass of wine a day is generally considered a heart-healthy choice. However, a new study shows that drinking even the smallest amounts of alcohol may be associated with an increased risk of cancer

title: Putin has pulled an ace out of his sleeve. The fearsome general is supposed to clean up the front
description: The Russians are putting on a good face and while on the one hand they are trying to ignore the Ukrainian attack on the Kursk region, they are quietly making decisions indicating that they do have problems there. They sent a special forces man to the scene, who became famous for his actions in Chechnya and Kosovo. Even terrorists could not defeat him.

title: More than 700 people sue McDonald's for employee harassment
description: More than 700 McDonald's restaurant workers in the UK have joined a class action harassment lawsuit against the US group, a year and a half after a BBC investigation exposed the practices.

title: New UK Congestion Charge. How much does it cost? Who does it apply to?
description: Starting tomorrow, tourists from the United States and Canada who cross the border into Great Britain in visa-free travel will be required to have a new document entitling them to enter the country. And this regardless of the final destination of the trip. What is Electronic Travel Authorization? How to buy it? How much does it cost? When will Poles have to buy an ETA?

title: Jean-Marie Le Pen has died. The founder of the National Front was 96 years old
description: Jean-Marie Le Pen, the founder of the far-right National Front, died on Tuesday at the age of 96, the AFP news agency reported on Tuesday, citing the politician's family. Le Pen was a symbol of the far-right in France. He ran for president five times - in 1974, 1988, 1995, 2002 and 2007.

title: In a few years, the energy of stars will be harnessed. The first power plant based on nuclear fusion will be built there
description: If all goes according to plan, the world's first nuclear fusion power plant will be built in Virginia. Commonwealth Fusion Systems says the plant is expected to be online and generating electricity in the early 2030s.

title: Trump Wants to Take Over Greenland! He's Sending His Son There
description: Newly elected US President Donald Trump is not giving up on his plans for Greenland. He has announced that he will send a delegation there, led by his son Donald Trump Jr., to "make Greenland great again".

title: Interest rates in Poland. Surprising forecast from Goldman Sachs
description: The scale of interest rate cuts in Poland will be greater than market valuations suggest - estimates Goldman Sachs bank. According to analysts from this bank, interest rates will fall by 150 bp this year to 4.25 percent. The current level of rates is 5.75 percent.

title: Sobolewski: Minimum wage hikes deprive the middle class of prosperity
description: Szymon Glonek from Forsal.pl talked to Kamil Sobolewski, chief economist of Employers of Poland, about economic forecasts for 2023, their implementation in 2024 and expectations for 2025. During the conversation, the issues of consumption dynamics, investments, inflation and monetary policy were discussed.

title: Vodka will pay for war. Russians have new regulations
description: Russians have another problem, this time caused by Vladimir Putin himself. On his initiative, alcohol prices have skyrocketed since the new year, reaching levels never seen before in history. As commentators assess, this is an indirectly cunning way to increase financing for further war.

title: Expansion of Ukrainian companies in Poland. Are we a base on the way to conquer the European Union?
description: The Russian invasion of 2022 forced many Ukrainians to flee their country. Some of them turned their life crisis into a business success and are successfully developing their companies in Central Europe. And there are many indications that Ukrainian businessmen are planning further expansion to the West.

title: Germany to increase defense spending to 3.5 percent of GDP? Scholz: It's immature
description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz described the proposal of Economy Minister Robert Habeck to increase defense spending to 3.5 percent of GDP as "immature". Who will pay for the increase in the defense budget from almost 80 to 140 billion euros? The citizens? - asked the head of the German government in an interview with the weekly "Stern".

title: Brutal Neo-Nazis Rise to Power in Wartime Russia, Terrorizing Russian Streets
description: Neo-Nazis in Russia have grown in strength and already have hundreds of thousands of supporters. This group no longer fears government repression, so it terrorizes Russian streets. Videos showing spectacular violence are a hit on the web, and official media support the neo-Nazi xenophobic narrative - we read in Jacobin.

title: Poland has the second lowest unemployment in the EU. New data available
description: 3 percent - that was the seasonally adjusted unemployment rate in Poland in November - Eurostat reported. A month earlier, this indicator was 3.1 percent. For comparison, in the eurozone, unemployment in November was 6.3 percent.

title: Companies are fighting for employees. These industries will now hire
description: Companies from the transport and logistics and automotive industries are announcing an increase in employment in the coming months - according to a report by ManpowerGroup. Four out of ten companies are planning new recruitments in the first quarter of this year.

title: "Have you lost your mind?" NATO official is furious with banks
description: Western rating agencies, banks and pension funds are acting "foolishly" by disregarding arms investments, senior NATO representative Adm. Rob Bauer told the Financial Times. Increasing defense spending is a necessity in the face of the growing threat of conflict, he emphasized.

title: Crazy disparity on Wall Street. Profits of 7 largest companies increased by 18%, other 493 by... 0.1%
description: The US stock exchange has two years of impressive growth behind it. The S&P 500 index gained over 20% in 2023 and 2024. However, it has a problem of huge concentration - the entire Wall Street is pulling a few companies on its shoulders. The profits of the 7 largest companies increased by 18% in the third quarter, the remaining 493 by... 0.1%.

title: What's next for butter prices? Strong assurance from the agriculture minister
description: A product that has recently attracted the public's attention has been the rising price of butter. On Tuesday, the Minister of Agriculture and Rural Development, Czesław Siekierski, assured that butter prices will fall. In his opinion, this is already visible in the agreements that are concluded in advance. The Minister recalled that the Ministry of Agriculture opposes the EU-Mercosur agreement and assured that Deputy Minister of Agriculture Michał Kołodziejczak will not resign.

title: Thick atmosphere in the Far East? Japan wants to buy over 1,000 missiles from the US
description: The Americans have agreed to a potential sale of AIM-120 AMRAAM air-to-air missiles to Japan. The authorities of the cherry blossom country have expressed a desire to buy as many as 1,200 of these missiles. This is not the first such request in recent years. What can this weapon do? What air force does Japan have?

title: Shares of Chinese giant collapsed. Reason? It became a "military company"
description: China's Tencent has been included by the US Department of Defense on the list of "Chinese military companies". The shares of the technology giant immediately dived - writes CNBC.

title: Russia has a big problem. They won with this weapon. Now it can change
description: It is difficult to point out a miracle weapon that will single-handedly change the course of war. However, there are some that are of key importance today. During the Ukrainian conflict, we can mention the M142 HIMARS launchers on the Ukrainian side and FAB guided bombs with UMPK modules on the Russian side. However, there are many indications that the Russians now have a serious problem with them.

title: BRICS is growing stronger as the world's fourth largest country by population joins the bloc
description: Indonesia has been admitted as a full member of the BRICS bloc of developing nations, Brazil, which holds the presidency until 2025, announced on Monday.

title: Trump Wants Canada to Join the US, But Canadians Have a Completely Different Opinion [POLL]
description: Many people in Canada want it to become the 51st state of the USA, and Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced his resignation because he knew that Washington would not tolerate trade deficits and subsidies, assessed Donald Trump, commenting on Trudeau's decision. He added that the USA and Canada would create a great country together.

title: Trump's son to visit Greenland. Media: It's humiliation for Danish government
description: The son of US President-elect Donald Trump, businessman Donald Trump Junior, will visit Greenland on Tuesday and meet with local politicians who support the island's independence, Greenlandic and Danish media reported on Monday.

title: Warsaw worse than Berlin. Here is the ranking of the most congested cities in the world
description: City traffic jams are a nightmare for all drivers around the world. However, drivers in Istanbul, New York and Chicago suffer the most from this - according to a report prepared by Inrix. Inrix's list of the most congested cities in the world also includes seven Polish cities. Check how they fared.

title: Canadian PM resigns. 'The situation has been building for several years'
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announced Monday that he will step down as party leader and thus cease to be prime minister. However, he will serve in his role until his successor is elected.

title: Will Europe be flooded with cheap food from South America? Another group of companies fears the EU-Mercosur agreement
description: Meat producers in Spain and Europe fear unfair competition if the European Union's agreement with Mercosur, an economic organization of South American countries, comes into force, the Spanish daily "ABC" wrote on Monday.

title: Ukrainian Naval Drones Attack Russian Air Defenses! Poland Should Learn from the Revolution in Naval Warfare
description: Ukrainian Armed Forces have destroyed another Russian Pantsir-S1 anti-aircraft system, this time using an FPV drone launched from an unmanned combat boat. The attack carried out in the Kherson region demonstrates the growing effectiveness of Ukrainian naval drones. The event confirms that even countries without a traditional navy can effectively conduct combat operations at sea.

title: Volkswagen wants to invest in China. 20,000 fast-charging stations to be built
description: The largest German car manufacturer, which is in a difficult situation, does not give up and takes a new initiative in China, the world's largest car market. Volkswagen and Xpeng have announced plans to expand their partnership. They will jointly build a network of super-fast charging stations for electric vehicles in the Middle Kingdom.

title: A foreign company does not have to have a plant in Poland to be a PIT payer
description: A foreign company that delegates employees to Poland must calculate, collect and pay advance tax on the salaries of delegated employees on an ongoing basis, even if it expects that its establishment will only be established in 12 months, the Supreme Administrative Court ruled.

title: The tax office boasts about the tax office's successes. Experts are reserved in assessing this data
description: In 2024, the National Revenue Administration detected the largest number of empty invoices since 2019. Moreover, as a result of its actions, taxpayers paid over PLN 15 billion to the budget, and the amount of their arrears decreased by PLN 3 billion from January to September 2024.

title: Koperski: Polish Waters are to protect against unjustified price changes [INTERVIEW]
description: - The draft bill is subject to ongoing consultations within the ministry's management, where, in addition to the Left, other political forces forming the government coalition are represented - says Przemysław Koperski, Undersecretary of State at the Ministry of Infrastructure.

title: Disputed temperature at work. There is no agreement in the government to change health and safety regulations
description: Complicated, unrealistic, paralyzing companies and even threatening state security - these are just some of the reservations of the ministries regarding the regulations regulating temperature in the workplace proposed by Minister Agnieszka Dziemianowicz-Bąk.

title: Litwiński: A private person publishing on the Internet is subject to GDPR [INTERVIEW]
description: - Just as in Molière's play, Mr. Jourdain spoke in prose the whole time, although he did not know it, we are all administrators of personal data, it's just that not all of us have been aware of it so far - notes Dr. Paweł Litwiński, attorney-at-law, partner at the Barta Litwiński law firm and member of the Social Team of Experts at the President of the Personal Data Protection Office.

title: From July 2025, trading in cryptocurrencies will require a permit
description: The Ministry of Finance announces that the delay in adopting the Polish act will not mean an additional year of peace for companies operating on the crypto-assets market.

title: Property tax 2025. Here are the most important changes
description: Entrepreneurs have an exceptional time this year until March 31 to declare property tax, but they must submit a special notification by the end of January. Owners of garages in residential buildings do not have to provide municipalities with any information in connection with the reduction in the tax rate.

title: Changes to civil servant exams postponed for a year. Even possible elimination of appointments
description: Changes to the exams for a civil servant will not appear until 2026, although they were already announced for this year. It is possible that it will not end with a modification of the exam itself; issues of the scope of duties of civil servants and even the elimination of appointments are also being considered.

title: Government tilting at windmills. Will the government fail to deliver on its pre-election promise?
description: Ministries are piling up difficulties in fulfilling their pre-election promise to reduce the distance of new wind turbines from buildings to 500 m.

title: They are accelerating work on biofuels. However, this is only a temporary solution
description: The delayed regulations are intended to adapt Polish law to EU requirements. Experts emphasize, however, that biofuels are only a temporary solution.

title: Lubnauer: Patostreaming will be included in the core curriculum [INTERVIEW]
description: - We are able to effectively combat children's addiction to smartphones and the dangers of the Internet only through education - says Katarzyna Lubnauer, Deputy Minister of Education.

title: Lex Romanowski to be amended. Amendment to the act raises doubts
description: The amendment to the act on the exercise of the mandate of a deputy and senator raises doubts not only among experts, but also among parliamentarians. As we hear, the inconsistencies are to be worked out in the committee.

title: Drivers are complaining, and rightly so. Here are the most congested cities in Poland
description: 110 hours in Łódź, 107 in Wrocław, 106 in Poznań – that's how much time drivers lost during rush hour last year. The development of transport infrastructure does not help to decongest cities.

title: Gas prices in Europe are rising. Raw material stocks in storage are falling rapidly
description: Low temperatures and the suspension of Russian crude transit through Ukraine have pushed prices to their highest level since October 2023.

title: Teachers' remuneration regulations - 20 most common mistakes made by councillors
description: We have analyzed court rulings so that you don't have to. The most common errors in granting bonuses to teachers. Some can even lead to the invalidation of entire resolutions by governors.

title: Functional supplement for a teacher in a new position. 9 most common mistakes
description: The functional allowance for teachers, as it results from the analysis of the decisions of the voivodes, in the resolutions of the bodies running educational institutions, is often incorrectly regulated. On what principles and to whom should it be awarded and where do municipalities most often make mistakes in this regard.

title: Teacher Motivational Supplement: 6 Most Common Mistakes That Can Affect Your Salary
description: The motivational allowance for teachers is not mandatory. However, it is in the rules concerning the criteria for awarding it and its amount that most mistakes are made by councilors when adopting it. Check which provisions have already been questioned and whether this applies to your situation.

title: Good news for passengers. It's about the renovation of the Warsaw cross-city line
description: Railway workers are inclined to renovate two tunnels of the Warsaw cross-city line at the same time - the long-distance and the suburban one.

title: Oil ambush for Trump. Biden delivered a symbolic blow to the new US president
description: Joe Biden is forcing his successor to fight a potentially costly political and legal battle over offshore drilling concessions.

title: Russian gas is not flowing through Ukraine to Europe. Slovakia and Moldova are doing fine, Transnistria is freezing
description: Moldova and Slovakia, which could be hit the hardest by Kiev's decision to halt Russian gas transit, have managed to cope with their problems. The situation in separatist Transnistria is dramatic.

title: Russia-Ukraine War. Day 1050
description: On February 24, 2022, Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine. At night, Ukrainian drones attacked Bryansk, Rostov, Saratov, and Belgorod regions.

title: Automotive Industry Crisis: How Will Car Manufacturers Cope in 2025?
description: The car industry is facing a series of complex issues, such as new emissions standards and weak sales of electric cars. European brands may find it particularly difficult to get through this year without any problems.

title: Michał Gramatyka: The future of the coalition? After the elections, everything will return to normal
description: - If the coalition of PiS, Solidarna Polska and Porozumienie, and later Kukiz, lasted eight years and was able to govern, why shouldn't ours last - said Michał Gramatyka (Polska 2050), Deputy Minister of Digital Affairs, in the "Rzecz o Polityce" programme.

title: Could Elon Musk Buy Liverpool? Billionaire Father Sent Signal
description: The British write that Elon Musk would like to buy Liverpool FC, although in the Labour stronghold he would be a foreign body. Fenway Sports Group is looking for investors, but does not plan to sell.

title: The Polish government has presented a new position before the ECJ. It concerns the status of judges
description: The Polish government presented a new position on the status of judges to the Court of Justice of the EU on Tuesday. It wants the court to rule on the criteria for examining the independence of judges and the possibility for national courts to disregard provisions that limit the effectiveness of EU law.

title: Demi Moore Wins Golden Globe After Being Almost Quit Acting
description: I have been working in this profession for 45 years and this is my first award. I accept it with humility and gratitude – said a clearly moved Demi Moore, accepting the Golden Globe for her role in the film "The Substance". In her speech, she mentioned difficult experiences.

title: Ukrainian drones in the depths of Russia. Fire in the city where strategic bombers are stationed
description: Ukrainian drones attacked targets in several regions of Russia at night, including Saratov. A large fire broke out in the city of Engels.

title: Janusz Jankowiak: Will it be brighter? Don't exaggerate, too many unknowns in 2025.
description: If anyone was hoping that the economy would become clearer in 2025, they need to seriously revise their expectations.

title: CES 2025 This Technology Will Turn Everyone Into a Powerhouse: Work and Leisure in a New Way
description: You can already feel like Tom Cruise in the movie "Edge of Tomorrow". The start-up Hypershell has developed a solution that refers to this science fiction movie. An exoskeleton supported by AI gives superhuman powers.

title: The nationwide competition for students in family and inheritance law is starting
description: The Department of Civil Law at Nicolaus Copernicus University in Toruń, which has been organizing the largest faculty knowledge competition on family and inheritance law for over a dozen years, is expanding it this year to include students from all academic centers in Poland.

title: BMW revolutionizes car operation. Panoramic iDrive will appear this year
description: BMW has unveiled a new concept in car operation at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas. BMW’s first-ever panoramic iDrive system will define the in-car experience in the upcoming Neue Klasse. Market launch in late 2025

title: Major Los Angeles Fire: The Film Stars District Burns
description: In Pacific Palisades, more than 30,000 people have evacuated their homes as a fire engulfs the upscale Los Angeles neighborhood.

title: Ryanair CEO advises governments on how to boost tourism. Three resolutions for the new year
description: Abolishing aviation taxes, reducing air traffic control fees, solving the problem of delays resulting from air traffic controllers' strikes and lifting traffic restrictions - Ryanair has published a list of demands for EU governments if they want to develop aviation, tourism and create jobs.

title: Melting Antarctic Ice to Awaken Dormant Volcanoes? New Scientists' Study
description: Melting ice in Antarctica due to climate change could trigger volcanic eruptions beneath the continent's ice sheet. They may not be visible, but the heat they release will accelerate the melting of the ice. This will create a feedback loop. In the long term, this could contribute to rising sea levels.

title: Sławomir Mentzen indicated who he would entrust with the role of the president's spokesman
description: - Grzegorz Braun is a very nice person, but it should be the case that the spokesman explains himself through the president, and not the president through the spokesman - said the Confederation's candidate in the presidential elections, Sławomir Mentzen, when asked whether he would consider choosing Grzegorz Braun as the head of the Chancellery of the President.

title: Debate. Travel agents: We guarantee stability and quality. It is worth investing in us
description: Tour operators and agents live in symbiosis. It is not worth jeopardizing good relationships for short-term benefits - said the panelists of the Tourism Leaders Meeting organized by our editorial team.

title: The transparency of public life is one of the foundations of the rule of law.
description: A municipal company performing public tasks is obliged to provide public information concerning it and related to the activities it undertakes, upon request or in the Public Information Bulletin.

title: Ministry of Digital Affairs responds to the tragedy in Wola. Transport companies will receive a new tool
description: The courier driver who fatally hit a 14-year-old in Warsaw's Wola district on Friday had an active driving ban. The Minister of Digital Affairs announced that in January he will provide transport companies and passenger transport intermediaries with the ability to automatically verify drivers' licenses.

title: Business: There is no coordination of economic policy in Donald Tusk's government. And there is a lot to improve
description: Business organizations hope for more decisive deregulation this year and for a serious debate on migration policy that takes into account the needs of the economy.

title: Podcast "Twój Biznes": NAREW program accelerates - 500 million for air defense
description: It's Wednesday, January 8 - Bartłomiej Kawałek invites you to "Twój Biznes", the daily economic podcast of "Rzeczpospolita". Today we will talk about half a billion zlotys for the NAREW program, changes in Facebook's moderation policy, Trump's plans for allies and the agreement for the supply of Romanian gas to Germany.

title: Government backs down on giving migrants cash to return to home country
description: The idea of ​​giving foreigners cash in hand as part of the so-called reintegration, however, ended up in the trash. It stirred controversy in the management of the Ministry of Interior and Administration itself.

title: Marek Migalski: Belweder is worth a mass. Rafał Trzaskowski cannot be an enemy of religion
description: When you look at Rafał Trzaskowski's staff, you get the impression that it's a group of Mexican revolutionaries who will soon start burning churches, nationalizing monasteries and repressing nuns and priests. This has to change, otherwise PiS will manage to glue the president of Warsaw to the image of an anticlerical who is out of touch with Polish reality.

title: Jarosław Kuisz: How to scare Poles?
description: 2025 will be a year of common scares. The months leading up to the presidential election will be filled with terror. Targowica, Prussian agents, and other demons of decline will pour out of screens large and small. Of course, interrupted by commercials and in versions updated to the 21st century. Polish politics will be raised to the level of a B-grade horror movie by algorithms from overseas.

title: Additional school holidays in autumn? MEN is looking into the matter
description: Students in Poland are overworked. Would better organization of the school year allow them to better distribute their strength over the ten school months? - We need to think about it - says Paulina Piechna-Więckiewicz, Deputy Minister of Education, in the podcast "Szkoła na nowo".

title: Andrzej Lepper is the patron of a new party in Poland. "The response is very big"
description: A group of activists has begun registering Andrzej Lepper's Samoobrona Odrodzenie. Although the late deputy prime minister was the embodiment of controversy in politics, smaller and larger groups are increasingly referring to him, and ideas for erecting monuments to him are also growing.

title: Zuzanna Dąbrowska: Why did Andrzej Duda not respond to Donald Tusk's invitation?
description: Andrzej Duda chose skiing in Kluszkowce instead of the inauguration of the EU presidency, so as not to endorse the current government, and Donald Tusk chose the EU summit in Brussels, not in Warsaw, to avoid promoting the president as the host. Here is Polish politics in a nutshell for the New Year.

title: Hołownia: The case with MP Romanowski is clear
description: - The case with MP (Marcin) Romanowski is clear: the MP (…) fled the country, but remains a MP, no one has deprived him of his mandate, nor has he resigned from it. He has decided, and has publicly announced it, that he will not exercise his mandate as a MP in the territory of the Republic of Poland in any way. In connection with the above, we must draw consequences from the decision that the MP has made - said Marshal Szymon Hołownia after the session of the Presidium of the Sejm.

title: Andrzej Domański's key decision on money for PiS is a matter of hours
description: The new political season has started. On Wednesday, Sejm Speaker Szymon Hołownia is to announce his decision regarding the date of the presidential elections. There is an ongoing debate in the coalition and the opposition about what the Minister of Finance Andrzej Domański will do. Of course, it concerns the PiS finances. The decision may be a matter of hours.

title: Shahla Kazimova: There was already a lot of distrust towards Russia in Azerbaijan
description: After the tragedy of the Azerbaijani Airlines plane, the slogan "Putin, apologize!" appeared. In Azerbaijan, no one writes about the disaster anymore, but about the crime - says Dr. Shahla Kazimova, head of the Center for Azerbaijani Studies at the University of Warsaw, in the podcast "Globalny Chrząszcz".

title: Presidential Palace: Will social media dominate the 2025 presidential campaign?
description: In the first episode of the "Pałac Prezydencki" podcast this year, Michał Kolanko talks to Michał Fedorowicz, head of the European analytical collective Res Futura. Not only about the presidential campaign, but also about its context and social moods in Poland at the turn of 2024 and 2025.

title: He hit an 18-year-old woman on a crosswalk. He was banned from driving.
description: On Monday evening in Grodzisk Mazowiecki, an 18-year-old woman was hit. The perpetrator of the accident turned out to be a man who had an active driving ban.

title: Szymon Hołownia assessed Marcin Romanowski's behavior. He called the PiS MP a coward
description: - Marcin Romanowski is not in exile. He deserted, he is a coward because he is afraid to take responsibility for his actions - said the Speaker of the Sejm Szymon Hołownia in an interview with RMF FM.

title: Karol Nawrocki asked about the words of Prof. Antoni Dudek. He speaks about a "compliment"
description: During a press conference, Karol Nawrocki responded to a journalist's question about the statements made by Prof. Antoni Dudek about the president of the Institute of National Remembrance, the presidential candidate supported by PiS.

title: What about the money from the budget for PiS? Grzegorz Schetyna announces a decision
description: PiS is trying to introduce legal dualism, this will be its policy that we will be observing throughout the election campaign - said KO senator Grzegorz Schetyna in an interview with RMF FM.

title: Amber Gold: Justice Slow After Biggest Financial Scandal
description: The prosecutor's office cleared the president of Finroyal, among others, of Amber Gold money laundering. The settlement of other guilty parties indicated by the investigative committee has stalled.

title: "Hot Potato", or Who Will Be Responsible for the Illegal Detention of Marcin Romanowski
description: Will a special department prosecuting prosecutors take over the case of Marcin Romanowski's detention at a time when he was protected by international immunity? Warsaw investigators have requested this.

title: Attorney Radosław Baszuk: I did not want to grow old in a country that decides for me
description: We cannot turn a blind eye to negative signals. I see the greatest crisis in terms of human rights at the border. It is there that the situation raises the greatest concerns about respect for basic human rights - says attorney Radosław Baszuk, who specializes in criminal cases, among other things.

title: Epiphany. The presidential couple published a message
description: - May this solemn bow unite us into a community not only on the day of the Epiphany, but also every day throughout 2025 - said President Andrzej Duda, who, together with his wife, Agata Kornhauser-Duda, delivered wishes on the occasion of the Epiphany.

title: 14-year-old fatally hit on a pedestrian crossing in Wola. Investigators want to arrest the suspected driver
description: The Warsaw prosecutor's office will file a motion to the court for temporary arrest of Andrzej K., a man suspected of fatally hitting a 14-year-old boy on a pedestrian crossing in Wola.

title: How much does it cost to maintain chaplains in the military?
description: Maintaining the facilities of the Military Ordinariate of the Polish Army costs the state budget over PLN 20 million – according to the answer given to the parliamentary question of the controversial MP by Deputy Minister of Defence Paweł Bejda.

title: Bydgoszcz: Serious fire in a hall. More than 30 fire brigades on site
description: On Sunday, a fire broke out in a hall located in the Bydgoszcz Industrial Park. Several dozen fire brigades are on site.

title: Krzysztof Bosak's strong words to KO MP Robert Kropiwnicki. He talks about "politically prostituted legal authorities"
description: You have brought down the authority of lawyers to such an extent that they will soon laugh at you – said Deputy Marshal Krzysztof Bosak (Confederation), addressing Civic Coalition MP Robert Kropiwnicki during a discussion on the National Electoral Commission's decision regarding PiS on Polsat News.

title: 14-year-old boy fatally hit. Driver arrested
description: Police have detained a 43-year-old man suspected of fatally hitting a 14-year-old boy in Warsaw's Wola district. The perpetrator fled the scene and the teenager died in hospital from his injuries.

title: A Thousand Years of Bolesław the Brave's Coronation. What Will Happen in Gniezno?
description: There are plans to hold a session of the National Assembly in Gniezno, as well as to organize the 12th Congress of Gniezno – in this way we will commemorate the millennium of the coronation of Bolesław the Brave and his successor Mieszko II.

title: Poll: Would another coalition politician be a better prime minister than Donald Tusk?
description: "In your opinion, would another politician from the current coalition be a better prime minister than Donald Tusk?" - this is the question we asked the participants of the SW Research survey for rp.pl.

title: Magdalena Biejat: People must always be at the centre of politics
description: I think that in 2024 in Warsaw I showed that I can effectively compete with Rafał Trzaskowski and I am ready for the next round at the national level – Magdalena Biejat, the New Left candidate for president, tells “Rzeczpospolita”.

title: Shopping left scattered on the crosswalk. Police looking for driver who hit 14-year-old with minibus and fled
description: The police are looking for the driver of a white or gray van who hit a 14-year-old boy on a marked crossing in Warsaw's Wola district on Friday. He left the scene without providing help. The boy was taken to hospital in critical condition. He died that night.

title: Marek Kozubal: Macierewicz, diplomatic betrayal and the Russians
description: The risk taken by General Jarosław Stróżyk by pointing to Macierewicz as a potential perpetrator of "diplomatic betrayal" may turn against him or... strengthen the state.

title: Donald Tusk sharply criticized Nawrocki. "The question is simple and deadly serious"
description: Donald Tusk has sharply criticized the absence of PiS-backed presidential candidate Karol Nawrocki at the opening ceremony of Poland's presidency of the European Union. "The question is simple and deadly serious: do you want a president who builds a safe and strong Europe, or one who, together with Putin and his allies, will destroy it?" he asked in a post on social media.

title: Survey: Poles on the state of the rule of law in Poland after a year of Donald Tusk's rule
description: "How, in your opinion, has the rule of law in Poland changed after a year of Donald Tusk's government being in power?" - this is the question we asked in the SW Research survey for rp.pl.

title: Reactive, ill-considered, without an idea. Such was the historical policy in 2024. What will it be like in this one?
description: The 80th anniversary of the end of World War II will most likely pass in an atmosphere of conflict rather than becoming a major international event.

title: Donald Tusk: If Europe is powerless, it will not survive
description: The ceremonial inauguration of the Polish presidency of the Council of the European Union took place at the Grand Theatre in Warsaw. - On 21 January, I will present the ambitious plans of the EU, the whole of Europe and the Polish presidency for these exceptionally difficult 6 months to the European Parliament - said Prime Minister Donald Tusk.

title: The Institute of National Remembrance is checking who took part in the executions
description: The prosecutor's office of the Institute of National Remembrance is trying to establish the circumstances of the crimes committed by the Germans against Poles and Jews during World War II.

title: Political Michałki: The new year begins, the National Electoral Commission with a hot potato, the refrigerator returns to politics
description: The new year in politics began with confusion over the decision of the National Electoral Commission and the controversy surrounding Marcin Romanowski. Will the disputes over the National Electoral Commission define the presidential campaign? How does the Romanowski case affect the image of PiS? What does the "political fridge" mean in an election year?

title: Inauguration of the Polish Presidency of the Council of the European Union without Andrzej Duda
description: President Andrzej Duda will not attend the inauguration ceremony of the Polish Presidency of the Council of the European Union at the Grand Theatre. "For the organizers, it was not an important event," said Małgorzata Paprocka, head of the Chancellery of the President.

title: "A state within a state". The president has made a sports field available to residents. He may end up in jail
description: The "Orlik" pitch in Puławy had to limit its activities a few years ago because a couple living next door complained about the noise. Now the city's president may end up in jail.

title: Paweł Szefernaker: Karol Nawrocki's presidential campaign financing? PiS was robbed
description: Paweł Szefernaker, who heads Karol Nawrocki's campaign team, said in an interview with Wirtualna Polska that the next stage of the election campaign of Karol Nawrocki - the PiS-supported presidential candidate - will begin soon, on January 6.

title: Prof. Antoni Dudek assesses that politics is approaching the limit. "Power may be the deciding factor"
description: Growing political tensions in Poland may make it difficult to organize the presidential elections in 2025, says political scientist and historian Prof. Antoni Dudek, considering it "questionable" whether they can be held in such a way that no one questions the result.

title: Ukrainians receive letters regarding mobilization. "It's a fake," the authorities assure
description: "In connection with the received signal about a fake letter sent to a citizen of Ukraine, the Office for Foreigners clarifies that it is not the author of the summons to perform military service," the office announced on its website.

title: Orlen without Formula 1 and the Polish Olympic Committee. A bit of common sense, a bit of politics
description: Orlen withdrew from sponsoring the Formula 1 team and financing the Polish Olympic Committee at the end of the year. Does this mean that the fuel company is giving up on supporting Polish sports?

title: Marcelina Zawisza on Zandberg's candidacy: The decision will be made by the National Council of the Razem party
description: Democracy is not about being either with Kaczyński or with Tusk and having to choose. Democracy is about being a democratic, opposition party in relation to one government and to the other government - said Razem MP Marcelina Zawisza on Polsat News.

title: The head of the Chancellery of the Prime Minister revealed when the Minister of Finance will speak out on the issue of money for PiS
description: Jan Grabiec, head of the Chancellery of the Prime Minister, told TVN24 when we can expect the Minister of Finance to speak out on the payment of funds to PiS for the 2023 parliamentary campaign. - I spoke with Andrzej Domański and I know that he is working on solving the Gordian knot that the Supreme Court woven by appointing neo-judges to rule on the PiS report, and later the National Electoral Commission - he emphasized.

title: Krzysztof Bosak on Rafał Trzaskowski. "This man is dangerous"
description: It is not Donald Tusk who will face consequences for his posts on social media, but Minister Andrzej Domański may be charged, assessed Deputy Speaker of the Sejm Krzysztof Bosak on radio station Trójka.

title: Poland does not want the Hungarian ambassador to be present at the inauguration of the EU presidency
description: Minister of Foreign Affairs Radosław Sikorski has sent a special note to the Hungarian embassy in Poland, which states that the participation of the Hungarian ambassador in the ceremonial inauguration of the Polish presidency of the EU "is not planned", Onet reports.

title: Michał Szułdrzyński: Poland's EU Presidency. It's not a six-month festival, but a tool for building Poland's role in Europe
description: Making good use of the presidency will allow Warsaw to confirm and strengthen the greater role of Poland and its leaders in Europe. However, we need to move from rounded slogans to real actions, such as urgently increasing security in the Baltic Sea.

title: Estera Flieger: Mamy za co chwalić III RP
description: Populists want to rely on ignorance: we praise too rarely what works. Meanwhile, we have something to appreciate about the Third Republic.

title: The shadow of the National Electoral Commission and the Supreme Court over the presidential campaign
description: Regardless of the final decisions, the dispute over money for PiS and uncertainty about the Supreme Court hang over the presidential campaign that is about to begin. What will the upcoming events bring?

title: Can Russians impersonate RCB Alert?
description: Incidents such as damage to optical fibers are analyzed in the context of potential hybrid activities, says Zbigniew Muszyński, director of the Government Security Center.

title: The problem of Polish drivers driving too fast is growing. Latest data
description: Drivers are not giving up on fast driving – the number of those who lost their driving license for speeding increased by almost 10%. There were five hundred more accidents, slightly fewer fatalities – this is the preliminary balance for 2024.

title: Adrian Zandberg on the presidential election: Opening the gates of hell
description: I am interested in the stability of these elections that are ahead of us. Because I do not want them to be decided not at the ballot box, but on the street - said Adrian Zandberg, co-leader of the Razem Party, on Polsat News.

title: Art 2024. A time of exhibition changes and personnel changes in museums and galleries
description: Contemporary art regained its full voice at exhibitions in 2024. And a major airing out of directors' offices began in museums and galleries.

title: Jacek Nizinkiewicz: Three ministers on whom the fate of Donald Tusk's government depends
description: The Ministers of Finance, Foreign Affairs and Justice will be the ones whose decisions will be crucial for the fate of the coalition on October 15. If they make mistakes, the government may not survive. The first perturbations ahead of Andrzej Domański after the decision of the National Electoral Commission.

title: There will be 100 million PLN for the Warsaw Uprising Museum
description: The Ministry of Culture has been co-running the Warsaw Uprising Museum since the beginning of this year. It has declared that it will provide money for the expansion of the facility.

title: Marcin Romanowski has made a decision on his status. "I have renounced"
description: It is not Tusk's "eye" or Bodnar's private opinions, but the Constitution that decides what is law in Poland. Stop Tusk's lawlessness - wrote Marcin Romanowski, former deputy minister of justice, on X, resigning from the status of a professional MP and receiving remuneration from the Chancellery of the Sejm.

title: Is real winter coming? A sudden cooling is ahead. Weather for the coming days
description: The weather outside the window is currently shaped by high-pressure wedges and low-pressure systems that alternately cover our country. However, from Friday, air masses of Arctic origin will begin to flow into us.

title: Kaczyński has nothing to reproach himself for regarding picnics. "The money would have been spent anyway"
description: PiS chairman Jarosław Kaczyński has nothing to reproach himself for when it comes to organizing military picnics before the 2023 parliamentary elections, where he openly encouraged people to vote for his party. He argued that the money planned for this purpose would have been spent anyway, so "the state did not lose anything."

title: Jarosław Kaczyński about Prof. Antoni Dudek: When he was young, he was very wrong
description: - Mr. (Antoni) Dudek may have personal grievances, this is the world of historians - said PiS chairman Jarosław Kaczyński, asked at a conference about the criticism of Karol Nawrocki, the chairman of the Institute of National Remembrance and the presidential candidate supported by PiS, formulated by the historian and political scientist.

title: Kaczyński criticizes Tusk for high prices. A refrigerator was brought to the conference
description: – We have a phenomenon that is simply called high prices. It is not that it could not have been prevented in any way. It could have been prevented – said PiS chairman Jarosław Kaczyński at a press conference.

title: We know how many soldiers took off their uniforms this year. As many as during Błaszczak's time
description: The number of soldiers in the Polish Army is growing. However, the new government has not managed to reverse the trend of large departures from service, which grew under the previous government. The most numerous are soldiers of the Territorial Defense Forces.

title: Krzysztof Bosak: Money for PiS? The Minister of Finance is in a difficult situation, but he should pay
description: - If the National Electoral Commission passed a resolution, which it was obliged to do, which is directly stated in the Electoral Code, then the earlier delay was unlawful, and the Minister of Finance should have done it - said Deputy Speaker of the Sejm Krzysztof Bosak (Confederation) in an interview with Polsat News, commenting on the National Electoral Commission resolution on the PiS financial report.

title: Prof. Antoni Dudek warns against Karol Nawrocki. "Ruthless, no inhibitions"
description: - Karol Nawrocki is a ruthless man, determined to succeed, and so far he has been going from success to success - says Professor Antoni Dudek about the president of the IPN, the presidential candidate supported by PiS.

title: Political Calendar for 2025: Elections, Anniversaries, Presidency and Rule of Law
description: In Polish politics, the year will be dominated by the presidential elections, which will take place in May 2025. The first event of the new political season will be their announcement. But that is not the only thing that is in the focus of politicians and campaign staff in 2025.

title: Drunk soldier escapes border with weapon and shoots at private car. "He was detained"
description: A soldier guarding the Polish-Belarusian border fired at a car in the town of Mielnik in Podlaskie Province, in which a father and his teenage daughter were traveling. "The man was captured by soldiers of the Task Force in Mielnik," the Operational Command of the Armed Forces reported.

title: "Busy night" for firefighters, police and paramedics. More fires than a year ago
description: Nearly 1,200 fires, almost twice as many as a year ago; 14,862 police interventions, many injured in accidents caused by exploding firecrackers. It was a busy night for the fire department, police and paramedics.

title: Michał Szułdrzyński: New Year's message and wishes of politicians like a declaration of Polish-Polish war
description: President Andrzej Duda and Prime Minister Donald Tusk, in addition to extending New Year's wishes, talked a lot about the 2025 presidential elections. Both presented them as the culmination of the political conflict to date. Will we survive a year of further deepening divisions?

title: Kazimierz Groblewski: National bets for the New Year 2025 – will the minister send a transfer to PiS or not?
description: Making a transfer to PiS, i.e. doing his job by the Minister of Finance Andrzej Domański, could mean – sooner or later – his resignation. This is the scale of the collapse of the state and Polish democracy.

title: New hope for the new year
description: Peace around our borders, which we long for; more understanding for others, which we need...

title: President's New Year's Address: Andrzej Duda Speaks of "Disturbing Signals" for Poland
description: President Andrzej Duda delivered a New Year's address in which he said, among other things, that Russia cannot win a war with Ukraine. The president criticized delays in the construction of the CPK and the nuclear power plant, pointed to the record-high budget deficit and assessed that the ruling coalition had led to chaos in the justice system.

title: Piotr Pytlakowski is dead. The famous investigative journalist was 73 years old
description: Piotr Pytlakowski, an investigative journalist, author and screenwriter, has died at the age of 73 after a long illness.

title: Resignation in the Ministry of Culture. It is known who will take over Andrzej Wyrobiec's departments
description: Undersecretary of State in the Ministry of Culture and National Heritage Andrzej Wyrobiec has resigned from his position. The ministry has announced who will take over supervision of the departments he coordinated.

title: Rafał Trzaskowski announces 5 percent of GDP for the military. "Security is the most important"
description: The year 2025 presents us with a great task, which is to rebuild the national community (...) Let us not allow ourselves to be divided any longer - let us recreate the community, because it is the strongest element of the state - emphasized Rafał Trzaskowski, the KO candidate for president, in his New Year's speech.

title: Donald Tusk: Until July we will remain in a system of law and lawlessness at the same time
description: It is hard to put up with a prime minister who is stubborn and organizes government meetings on Christmas Eve and New Year's Eve. These days are working days for all working people, including ladies and gentlemen ministers - said Prime Minister Donald Tusk before the government meeting. The prime minister announced that 2025 will be a time of breakthrough.

title: Poll: Is Donald Tusk a good prime minister? We know what Poles think
description: Almost half – 48.7 percent – ​​of respondents are critical of Donald Tusk as prime minister, according to a United Surveys poll for the wp.pl portal. The head of government is viewed negatively by as many as 95 percent of PiS and Confederation voters.

title: Morawiecki: Money will be found. Tusk and Domański have no movement
description: If Finance Minister Andrzej Domański does not pay the money to Law and Justice, he will face the State Tribunal in the future, says former Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki, commenting on Monday's decision of the National Electoral Commission on the report of Jarosław Kaczyński's party.

title: Who gained and who lost the most in national politics in 2024?
description: Two election campaigns, the beginning of the clash for the Presidential Palace, tensions in the government and coalition, settling accounts with the previous government, geopolitics, the war in Ukraine – it is hard to believe that all these events have taken place in the last 12 months. Who has gained politically this year and who cannot consider it a success?

title: The biggest scandals of 2024. From the release of a Russian spy to the escape of Marcin Romanowski
description: Settling accounts with the Justice Fund with politics in the background, the diploma scandal at Collegium Humanum and the state's strategic purchases for its own people – what were we living through in 2024?

title: Donald Tusk lacked instinct and restraint
description: Putting the finance minister in a difficult position, quoting words that for years brought only defeats to his own political camp and escalation of the Polish-Polish war, in other words Donald Tusk scores a hat trick after the decision of the National Electoral Commission. The prime minister scored all three goals in his own net.

title: A hanukkah was set on fire in the Sejm. Grzegorz Braun protests with fire extinguishers in front of the Sejm
description: On the occasion of the beginning of the Hanukkah holiday, a candle was lit in the Sejm, as every year, on the traditional hanukkiah. Grzegorz Braun protested this time in front of the Sejm with a group of supporters.

title: Ryszard Kalisz: The Minister of Finance should not pay subsidies to PiS
description: Please ask your colleagues why other members of the National Electoral Commission voted in favour of adopting the report or abstained from voting, said Ryszard Kalisz, a member of the National Electoral Commission, in "Kropka nad I".

title: Jacek Nizinkiewicz: The National Electoral Commission was right to accept the PiS financial report. But that's not the end
description: Taking away the subsidy from the largest opposition party would be part of the worst practices of undemocratic governments. PiS should be punished for its mistakes, but it's good that the subsidy was not taken away in its entirety. Now it's time to depoliticize the National Electoral Commission.

title: The head of government accepts the decision of the National Electoral Commission. "There is no money and there will be no money"
description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk commented in a short post on social media on the decision made today by the National Electoral Commission, adopting the financial report of Law and Justice.

title: Incorrect checkerboard? Experts point out error in marking of Polish fighters
description: The government has submitted a bill to the Sejm that would allow the use of a "low visibility" aviation checkerboard, i.e. in shades of grey, on F-35 aircraft. It ignored the voices of heraldists that it would be painted correctly only on half of the aircraft – "Rzeczpospolita" has learned.

title: After the National Electoral Commission's decision. PiS politicians see the finance minister before the Supreme Court. "Things will be back to normal"
